title: Data Engineer
descriptionHtml:
Department

IT Services

Salary

£37,694 - £46,049 per year

Grade

Grade 6

Contract status

Open

Hours of work

Full-time

Based at

University of York campus (with some remote working options available)

Posted Date

13/08/2025

Apply by

27/08/2025

Job Reference

14242

Documents

  • Candidate Brief 14242.pdf (PDF, 2774.16kb)

Role Description

Data Engineer (Leading UK University)

People are key to our technology-driven transformation. Through our people, services and projects, we deliver the digital experience to empower work, study, learning and research. We’re customer centric, employing co-design principles, and use customer friendly language. We aim to build services that are intuitive, reliable and stress-free (IT that “just works”) and are committed to accessibility.

The Opportunity

The IT Services team at York have developed a strong DevOps and modern Software Engineering practice working on cloud based projects, as well as those hosted on our own data centres. This Data Engineer role will play a key part in further developing our data engineering and DataOps capability, by making full use of the latest cloud based data pipelines.

You'll join a dynamic team to transform data for system integration and analysis, developing robust data pipelines with modern practices like version control and automation. You'll contribute to data governance and collaborate with various data professionals. Beyond technical skills, a positive, adaptable, and eager-to-learn mindset is highly valued, with comprehensive training provided to support your growth.

Key Requirements

  • Level 3 qualification (see full list) or equivalent professional experience.
  • Hands-on experience with SQL.
  • Familiarity with data modelling concepts and techniques, such as data entity diagrams.
  • Ability to gather, analyse, interpret, and report complex data/information.
  • Experience with data warehouse systems (desirable).
  • Knowledge of Python or other modern programming languages. (desirable).
  • Awareness of legal issues related to data, such as the Data Protection, Freedom of Information, and Computer Misuse Acts. (desirable).

Excellent Benefits

The University of York offers a compelling benefits package, including:

  • Hybrid working, allowing up to 4 days of remote work per week.
  • 38 days of annual leave (inclusive of bank holidays).
  • Flexible working options and up to 12 days of additional flexible leave per year.
  • A generous pension scheme with 14.5% employer contributions.
  • Access to onsite gym and nursery facilities.
  • A Cycle2Work scheme and access to healthcare benefits through Rewards Extra.

You will work within collaborative, multi-disciplinary teams, partnering with data architects , analysts, and other IT professionals to ensure robust data management across the institution. We promote a supportive atmosphere and encourage shared learning. (https://features.york.ac.uk/university-of-york-it-services-jobs/)

Get in Touch

For an informal discussion about this position, please contact Thomas Wright, Lead Software Engineer, at thomas.wright2@york.ac.uk.

Interview date: To be confirmed

The University strives to be diverse and inclusive – a place where we can ALL be ourselves.

We particularly encourage applications from people who identify as Black, Asian or from a Minority Ethnic background, who are underrepresented at the University.

We offer family friendly, flexible working arrangements, with forums and inclusive facilities to support our staff. #EqualityatYork

title: HR Systems Administrator
descriptionHtml:
Why work at Nebius

Nebius is leading a new era in cloud computing to serve the global AI economy. We create the tools and resources our customers need to solve real-world challenges and transform industries, without massive infrastructure costs or the need to build large in-house AI/ML teams. Our employees work at the cutting edge of AI cloud infrastructure alongside some of the most experienced and innovative leaders and engineers in the field.


Where we work

Headquartered in Amsterdam and listed on Nasdaq, Nebius has a global footprint with R&D hubs across Europe, North America, and Israel. The team of over 800 employees includes more than 400 highly skilled engineers with deep expertise across hardware and software engineering, as well as an in-house AI R&D team.


The team

The People Systems team plays a critical role in enabling the HR organization through the strategic use of technology. We manage a wide range of initiatives, including end-user support for our HRIS (HiBob), ongoing systems optimization, and the development of our broader HR tech roadmap.


The role


As an HR Systems Administrator, you will be the go-to expert for HR systems—especially our core platform, HiBob. This is a systems-focused role that requires strong technical aptitude, attention to detail, and a service-oriented mindset. You’ll work closely with the HR team and downstream stakeholders to investigate, resolve, and improve system-related requests, while continuously identifying opportunities for automation and efficiency. The ability to manage and improve HR systems is central to this role.


You’re welcome to work remotely from the USA.


Your responsibilities will include:


  • Provide end-user support for our HR systems, developing a robust understanding of how users interact with HiBob and troubleshooting the challenges they face
  • Develop a strong understanding of our HR systems and play an active role in the rollout and testing of new functionality
  • Independently identify opportunities for automation and self-service within HiBob
  • Maintain overview of both ad hoc support requests and tickets related to larger initiatives, ensuring timely resolution and effective tracking within the ticketing system
  • Identify and propose solutions to tackle end user knowledge gaps
  • Create and maintain well-organized and accessible documentation of knowledge in Confluence
  • Contribute to the successful implementation of new processes and systems by supporting their rollout and adoption


We expect you to have:


  • Excellent verbal and written communication in English
  • 2-4 years of experience in Talent Acquisition or HR, with an emphasis on system administration and end-user support
  • Proven experience in automating previously manual work
  • Experience working in a state-of-the-art HRIS – experience with HiBob is strongly preferred
  • Experience working with SLAs
  • Experience using Jira or comparable ticketing systems


Key Employee Benefits:


  • Health Insurance: 100% company-paid medical, dental, and vision coverage for employees and families.
  • 401(k) Plan: Up to 4% company match with immediate vesting.
  • Parental Leave: 20 weeks paid for primary caregivers, 12 weeks for secondary caregivers.
  • Remote Work Reimbursement: Up to $85/month for mobile and internet.
  • Disability & Life Insurance: Company-paid short-term, long-term, and life insurance coverage.


Compensation


We offer competitive salaries, ranging from 83k-96k base + quarterly bonuses based on your experience, skills, and location.


What we offer

  • Competitive salary and comprehensive benefits package.
  • Opportunities for professional growth within Nebius.
  • Hybrid working arrangements.
  • A dynamic and collaborative work environment that values initiative and innovation.


We’re growing and expanding our products every day. If you’re up to the challenge and are excited about AI and ML as much as we are, join us!

and testing of new functionalityIndependently identify opportunities for automation and self-service within HiBobMaintain overview of both ad hoc support requests and tickets related to larger initiatives, ensuring timely resolution and effective tracking within the ticketing systemIdentify and propose solutions to tackle end user knowledge gapsCreate and maintain well-organized and accessible documentation of knowledge in ConfluenceContribute to the successful implementation of new processes and systems by supporting their rollout and adoptionWe expect you to have: Excellent verbal and written communication in English2-4 years of experience in Talent Acquisition or HR, with an emphasis on system administration and end-user supportProven experience in automating previously manual workExperience working in a state-of-the-art HRIS – experience with HiBob is strongly preferredExperience working with SLAsExperience using Jira or comparable ticketing systemsKey Employee Benefits:Health Insurance: 100% company-paid medical, dental, and vision coverage for employees and families.401(k) Plan: Up to 4% company match with immediate vesting.Parental Leave: 20 weeks paid for primary caregivers, 12 weeks for secondary caregivers.Remote Work Reimbursement: Up to $85/month for mobile and internet.Disability & Life Insurance: Company-paid short-term, long-term, and life insurance coverage.CompensationWe offer competitive salaries, ranging from 83k-96k base + quarterly bonuses based on your experience, skills, and location.What we offerCompetitive salary and comprehensive benefits package.Opportunities for professional growth within Nebius.Hybrid working arrangements.A dynamic and collaborative work environment that values initiative and innovation.We’re growing and expanding our products every day. If you’re up to the challenge and are excited about AI and ML as much as we are, join us!

title: Python Engineer
descriptionHtml:
Must Have skills: Developing Automation Scripts using Python, Middleware Platforms, AI Integrations

Job Description:

This role will focus on building automation solutions to enhance middleware infrastructure and operational efficiency, with a strong emphasis on leveraging AI-driven technologies (including tools like ChatGPT) to improve processes and performance.

You will work closely with engineering and operations teams to design, implement, and maintain automation frameworks that support critical middleware platforms across the enterprise.

Key Responsibilities

  • Design, develop, and maintain automation scripts and frameworks using Python and shell scripting to streamline middleware operations and deployments.
  • Collaborate with middleware engineers to identify automation opportunities in provisioning, configuration, monitoring, and incident resolution.
  • Integrate AI tools (including Chat GPT and other LLM-based solutions) into automation workflows for predictive analytics, intelligent troubleshooting, and enhanced operational insights.
  • Partner with infrastructure and application teams to ensure automation aligns with enterprise security, compliance, and performance standards.
  • Contribute to AI-driven proof of concepts and pilots for automation in the middleware space.
  • Provide support for automation tools and scripts in production, ensuring stability and reliability.
  • Maintain documentation for developed scripts, workflows, and integrations.

Required Skills & Experience

  • Strong proficiency in Python and shell scripting (Bash, KornShell, etc.).
  • Proven experience developing automation solutions for middleware platforms (e.g., WebSphere, WebLogic, Tomcat, MQ, Kafka, etc.).
  • Solid understanding of AI concepts and experience integrating AI/ML models or APIs (OpenAI, ChatGPT, Azure Cognitive Services, etc.) into automation processes.
  • Familiarity with enterprise infrastructure environments, including Linux/Unix administration.
  • Strong problem-solving and analytical skills, with the ability to troubleshoot complex middleware and automation issues.
  • Experience with version control (Git), CI/CD pipelines, and DevOps practices.

Ability to work in a fast-paced, large-scale financial services environment

title: Payroll Automation & Data Specialist
descriptionHtml:
About Remote

Remote is solving modern organizations’ biggest challenge – navigating global employment compliantly with ease. We make it possible for businesses of all sizes to recruit, pay, and manage international teams. With our core values at heart and future focused work culture, our team works tirelessly on ambitious problems, asynchronously, around the world. You can find Remoters working from 6 different continents (Antarctica left to go!) and all of our positions are fully remote.

We encourage every member of the Remote team to bring their talents, experiences and culture to the table to help us build the best-in-class HR platform.

If you are energetic, curious, motivated and ambitious, be part of our world. Apply now and define the future of work!

What This Job Can Offer You

This is an exciting time to join Remote and make a personal difference in the global employment space as a Payroll Automation & Data Specialist, joining our Payroll team, working collaboratively with cross-functional teams to deliver outstanding payroll services to our employees and customers.

What You Bring

  • Experience in payroll process analysis or process automation.
  • Skilled in utilising Excel and Google Sheets formulas to perform calculations, analyse data, and automate tasks.
  • Expert level, leveraging full-stack engineering to deliver limited but well-rounded solutions in short periods of time.
  • Proficiency in SQL and Cloud computing platforms like AWS or GCP.
  • Good decision-making skills and a pragmatic approach to problem-solving.
  • Python knowledge is a plus
  • Strong English written and verbal communication skills for clear articulation of business requirements and outcomes.
  • It's not required to have experience working remotely, but considered a plus.


Key Responsibilities

  • Assist in analyzing business processes and performance metrics data to identify potential opportunities and benefits.
  • Develop, test, and deploy of automation solutions across Payroll processes.
  • Contribute to the creation of Business Requirement Documents (BRDs) for automating manual processes to improve efficiency and support business growth.
  • Participate in post-implementation performance reviews, analyzing if adjustments are needed and ensuring projects deliver against KPIs.
  • Help deploy process improvements, finding minimal solutions to problems.
  • Collaborate with Engineering, Product, and Payroll teams to develop solutions for complex problems.
  • Continuously learn and share new skills, tools, technologies and utilize them to unlock new challenges and opportunities at Remote
  • Communicate effectively with stakeholders, aiding in the implementation of solutions, coordinating action plans, setting timelines, and prioritizing tasks for successful project delivery.
  • Identify and propose change management or training needs for automation projects delivered.


Practicals

  • You'll report to: Manager, Payroll Business Operations
  • Team: Payroll - Payroll Business Operations
  • Location: For this position we welcome everyone to apply, but we will prioritize applications from the following locations as we encourage our teams to diversify; EMEA or US
  • Start date: As soon as possible


Application process

Roughly 2 hours across 4 weeks

  • Async Take Home Test
  • Interview with Recruiter
  • Interview with team members
  • Interview with hiring manager and Payroll Automation & Data Specialist
  • Bar Raiser Interview
  • Prior employment verification check


Remote's Total Rewards philosophy is to ensure fair, unbiased compensation and fair equity pay along with competitive benefits in all locations in which we operate. We do not agree to or encourage cheap-labor practices and therefore we ensure to pay above in-location rates. We hope to inspire other companies to support global talent-hiring and bring local wealth to developing countries.

At first glance our salary bands seem quite wide - here is some context. At Remote we have international operations and a globally distributed workforce. We use geo ranges to consider geographic pay differentials as part of our global compensation strategy to remain competitive in various markets while we hiring globally.

Our salary ranges are determined by role, level and location, and our job titles may span more than one career level. The actual base pay for the successful candidate in this role is dependent upon many factors such as location, transferable or job-related skills, work experience, relevant training, business needs, and market demands. The base salary range may be subject to change.

At Remote, we foster internal mobility as a key element of our culture of employee growth and development, supported by a compensation philosophy that guarantees pay equity and fairness. Therefore, all compensation changes associated with an internal move will be reviewed by the Total Rewards & People Enablement team on a case by case basis.

The annual salary range for this full-time position is

$88,400—$99,450 USD

Benefits

Our full benefits & perks are explained in our handbook at remote.com/r/benefits. As a global company, each country works differently, but some benefits/perks are for all Remoters:

  • work from anywhere
  • flexible paid time off
  • flexible working hours (we are async)
  • 16 weeks paid parental leave
  • mental health support services
  • stock options
  • learning budget
  • home office budget & IT equipment
  • budget for local in-person social events or co-working spaces


How You’ll Plan Your Day (and Life)

We work async at Remote which means you can plan your schedule around your life (and not around meetings). Read more at remote.com/async.

You will be empowered to take ownership and be proactive. When in doubt you will default to action instead of waiting. Your life-work balance is important and you will be encouraged to put yourself and your family first, and fit work around your needs.

If that sounds like something you want, apply now!

How To Apply

  • Please fill out the form below and upload your CV with a PDF format.
  • We kindly ask you to submit your application and CV in English, as this is the standardised language we use here at Remote.
  • If you don’t have an up to date CV but you are still interested in talking to us, please feel free to add a copy of your LinkedIn profile instead.


Not only do we encourage folks from all ethnic groups, genders, sexuality, age, abilities, disability status and any other under-represented group to apply, but we prioritize a sense of belonging. We have 4 ERGs (Women, Disability, Queer, Minorities in Tech) who meet regularly with the People team. During your interviews and beyond, we ask & encourage anybody who needs an accommodation to request one from their recruiter.

We will ask you to voluntarily tell us your pronouns at interview stage, and you will have the option to answer our anonymous demographic questionnaire when you apply below. As an equal employment opportunity employer it’s important to us that our workforce reflects people of all backgrounds, identities, and experiences and this data will help us to stay accountable. We thank you for providing this data, if you chose to.

At Remote, we embrace AI as a valuable tool while prioritizing human creativity and authenticity. We look forward to meeting candidates who balance innovation with genuine expertise and experience. To learn more about Remote's AI guidelines check see here.

Please note we accept applications on an ongoing basis.

title: Marketing Content Specialist
descriptionHtml:
Ecorobotix Inc. creates innovative robotic solutions that reduce the negative ecological impact of modern agriculture. We have developed an AI-based ultra-high precision spot spraying technology that drastically reduces the amount of chemicals used in crop fields while keeping costs competitive. The technology is currently deployed on our tractor-towed ARA machine. By joining our talented and dynamic team, you will contribute to a more sustainable, environment-friendly agriculture in an innovative scale-up at the cutting edge of technology. We are a revolutionary organization with a great work environment that supports creativity through self-motivation.

To pursue our growth in the USA, we are hiring an experienced entrepreneurial mind for a:


Marketing Content Specialist


General objective of the role

At Ecorobotix, we believe every vegetable producer deserves tools that help them work smarter, reduce costs, and grow stronger businesses. As our Marketing Content Specialist, you will bring this story to life.


As the Marketing Content Specialist, you will create and manage content that shows growers how ultra-high precision spraying technology can reduce labor and input costs while increasing profit. From crafting clear, practical content that connects with growers to designing print and digital ads that stand out in the market, you will translate technical details into clear, relatable stories that matter to growers. You will produce videos, write articles, design visuals, and manage content across platforms to support campaigns and product launches. Your work will help farmers see what’s possible and move them to take action with Ecorobotix.


Reporting lines and interactions

This role reports directly to the Marketing & Communications Manager of North America. On the day-to-day, the person covering this role will be working closely with other teams of Ecorobotix Inc. as well as the marketing team of Ecorobotix SA.


Key Responsibilities

• Design graphics using Adobe Creative Suite for ads, social media, and marketing collateral.

• Update and maintain website content on WordPress and Wix, including blogs, landing pages, and resource libraries.

• Manage and create digital and print advertisements for lead generation, product promotions, dealer campaigns, and events.

• Produce and edit short-form video content (e.g., customer testimonials, product demonstrations, reels).

• Create clear, engaging content for social media, newsletters, website, email campaigns, landing pages and print materials.

• Develop and maintain a content calendar aligned with marketing campaigns and product launch plans.

• Assist in executing marketing automation campaigns within CRM and email platforms.

• Track and report on content and campaign performance using CRM, Google Analytics and platform insights.

• Collaborate with agronomy, sales, and customer success teams to source content ideas and customer stories.

• Support content creation and promotion for field demos, tradeshows, and dealer events.

• Ensure consistent branding and messaging across all content and advertisements.

• Occasional travel to the Washington office in Pasco, trade shows or in-field events.


Qualifications & Skills

• Preferred Bachelor in one of the following areas: Marketing, Communications, Public Relations and/or Agricultural Sciences, Ag-Business

• 5+ years in graphic design, content creation, content marketing, or digital marketing roles is preferred.

• Hands-on experience with WordPress for content updates and page optimization.

• Proficiency with Adobe Creative Suite (Photoshop, Illustrator, Premiere Pro).

• Experience designing print and digital ads for B2B marketing.

• Experience managing business social media accounts and scheduling content.

• Familiarity with CRM systems (e.g., Constant Contact Lead Gen & CRM (formerly SharpSpring), HubSpot or Salesforce)

• Experience using email marketing and marketing automation platforms.

• Basic video capture and editing skills.

• Understanding content and ad performance tracking using Google Analytics or similar tools.

• Strong organizational and time management skills, with the ability to manage multiple projects.

• Excellent written and verbal communication skills.

• Experience in agriculture, ag technology, or technical product industries is preferred.


Your Assets

• Able to translate technical topics into clear, practical content for growers.

• Detail-oriented with a drive for quality and accuracy.

• Adaptable and comfortable working in a fast-paced, innovative environment.

• A team player who can collaborate across departments while independently managing projects.

title: Document Automation Technician (EMS)
descriptionHtml:
**Telework Eligible**

Yes

**Major Duties**

  • Assigned to the DLA Document Services Equipment Management Solutions (EMS) Processing Center (EPC) and reports to the EPC Branch Chief.
  • Works closely with the EPC Asset and Funding Specialists, as well with the assigned EPC Contract Specialists and EPC Branch Chief, on a daily basis to post EMS assets into the DLA Enterprise Business System (EBS), ensuring accuracy of each entry.
  • Performs a variety of key administrative duties associated with the execution of the EMS Program with an emphasis on Accounts Receivable (AR) management processes.
  • Works independently within the DLA Enterprise Business System (EBS) for managing the administrative responsibilities of EMS billing, funding, and asset management processes.
  • Sends and receives EMS customer renewal packages requesting funding from the customer, and ensures all assets are fully funded on time.
  • Reviews funding balances and returns unused funding to customer.
  • Works with EPC EMS Funding and Asset Master Specialist to prevent EMS accounts receivable from aging over 90 days.
  • Reconciles customer accounts as needed or as directed. Maintains off-line Excel spreadsheet or database for all funding of assets.
  • Manually creates sales orders for purchases and all other billing not automatically generated by the EBS system.
  • Participates in conference calls with the assigned EPC Branch team as required in support of addressing customer concerns, data analysis and meeting overall EMS program objectives.
  • Resolves customer billing issues and seeks assistance on the more complex/difficult issues from the EPC Contract Specialist and EPC Branch Chief level when needed.
  • Day to day communications with customers to resolve any issues that may arise.

**Qualification Summary**

To qualify for a Document Automation Technician (EMS), your qualifications must include: A. Specialized Experience: To qualify at the GS-07 level, applicants must possess one year of specialized experience equivalent to the GS-06 level or equivalent under other pay systems in the Federal service, military, or private sector. Applicants must meet eligibility requirements including time-in-grade (General Schedule (GS) positions only), time-after-competitive appointment, minimum qualifications, and any other regulatory requirements by the cut-off/closing date of the announcement. Creditable specialized experience includes: Responsible for the return of unused customer funds and resolves customer billing issues. Assists with the reconciliation and verification of all EMS contract invoices on a monthly basis ensuring proper payment in timely manner, preventing accounts payable from aging greater than 90 days. B. Education: As a general rule, education is not creditable above GS-5 for most positions covered by this standard; however, graduate education may be credited in those few instances where the graduate education is directly related to the work of the position. Experience refers to paid and unpaid experience, including volunteer work done through National Service programs (e.g., Peace Corps, AmeriCorps) and other organizations (e.g., professional, philanthropic, religious, spiritual, community, student, social). Volunteer work helps build critical competencies, knowledge, and skills and can provide valuable training and experience that translates directly to paid employment. You will receive credit for all qualifying experience, including volunteer experience.

title: Medical Device/IoT Security Architect
descriptionHtml:
Maveris is an IT and cybersecurity services company committed to helping organizations create secure digital solutions to accelerate their mission. We are Veteran-owned and proud to serve customers across the Federal Government and private sector. We have an opening for a full-time, permanent Medical Device/IoT Security Architect to join our talented, dynamic team in support of a large Federal Government customer.

Veterans are encouraged to apply.

The Medical Device/IoT Security Architect will support the Department of Veterans Affairs by providing technical and programmatic support services to include development, maintenance, enterprise architecture, and administrative engineering support.

Duties

As a Medical Device/IoT Security Architect supporting Maveris programs, you will be trusted to lead the delivery of a Federal Agency's Enterprise Security Architecture and Strategy. In this role, a typical day will include:

  • Provide thought leadership for new techniques and design patterns related to Enterprise Security Architecture within the domain of Automation and DevSecOps
  • Ensure that the Enterprise Security Architecture, framework, and strategy across the enterprise remains consistent with and supports the NIST Cybersecurity Framework and other federal mandates
  • Design security patterns and reference architectures that ensure the confidentiality, integrity, and availability of sensitive medical data, safeguarding patient safety, and comply with regulatory standards such as HIPAA
  • Conduct risk assessments, threat modeling, and aid in vulnerability testing for IoT and medical devices, identifying potential security risks and recommending mitigations.
  • Architect secure communication protocols (e.g., TLS, HTTPS, MQTT) and encryption methods to protect data in transit and at rest between IoT devices, medical systems, and cloud platforms.
  • Collaborate with medical device manufacturers, healthcare providers, and IT teams to embed security controls within device firmware, software, and hardware, including encryption, access control, and secure boot.
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to embed security across the lifecycle of connected devices, from design and deployment to ongoing monitoring and incident response.

Requirements

  • Bachelor's degree
  • 7 years of relevant experience
  • Hands-on experience securing connected medical devices and IoT environments in healthcare or other highly regulated industries
  • Experience working with healthcare standards, such as HIPAA, FDA guidelines, and IEC 80001, for medical devices
  • Experience with security frameworks and methodologies (NIST Cybersecurity Framework, ISO 27001)
  • Knowledge of network security, wireless protocols, and data encryption specific to IoT environments
  • Experience with cybersecurity tools such as vulnerability scanners, SIEM, and threat detection systems
  • Hands-on experience with Zero Trust security models

Benefits

Maveris attracts and retains talent of the highest caliber by offering opportunities to work in exciting and challenging environments surrounded by bright minds. Our employees are our most prized asset and are rewarded with highly competitive compensation and a top-tier benefits package, including:

  • 401(k) with company match
  • Dental Insurance
  • Health Insurance
  • Vision Insurance
  • Life Insurance
  • Paid Time Off

About Maveris

Maveris offers exceptional, mission-focused, solutions to organizations facing highly complex IT, digital, and cybersecurity challenges. Our success is achieved by maintaining an environment of trust where people are encouraged to reach their fullest potential. Every candidate that applies to Maveris brings something unique to the table, and because our team is diverse, we consistently meet our goals and exceed client expectations. If you are a highly-motivated person with a willingness to learn, we invite you to apply today to join our team!

To Learn More About Employee Benefits Visit Www.maveris.com.

For company updates and the latest job postings check us out on LinkedIn.

If you'd like to read about some of our research and projects head over to Maveris Labs.

Want a more behind the scenes view? Check out our blog Maveris Insights to learn more about the team behind the solutions.

title: Subscription Operations Specialist (Remote - US)
descriptionHtml:
This position is posted by Jobgether on behalf of Bloomerang. We are currently looking for a Subscription Operations Specialist in the United States.

This role is ideal for a detail-oriented and customer-focused professional who enjoys working directly with clients to manage subscription lifecycles, from renewals to cancellations. You will serve as a critical point of contact for customers, ensuring their needs are met while balancing company processes and policies. Collaborating with cross-functional teams, you will help optimize subscription operations, identify process improvements, and implement solutions that enhance efficiency. The role combines negotiation, analytical thinking, and product expertise, offering the opportunity to contribute meaningfully to the organization's mission while developing your skills in subscription management and operations. This is a fully remote, full-time position in a supportive, mission-driven environment.

Accountabilities

  • Manage subscription lifecycles including renewals, downgrades, and cancellations, ensuring a smooth and accurate customer experience
  • Serve as a liaison between customers and internal teams such as sales and customer support to resolve subscription discrepancies
  • Develop deep expertise in product offerings and bundled solutions to facilitate contract adjustments and optimize outcomes
  • Conduct negotiations with customers regarding subscription terms and adjustments, balancing customer satisfaction with business goals
  • Identify operational inefficiencies and explore automation opportunities to improve subscription management processes
  • Maintain accurate records in the billing system, including customer contracts, subscription changes, and renewal documentation
  • Collaborate with internal stakeholders to support process improvements, reporting, and data-driven decision-making


Requirements

  • 1-3 years of experience in collections, billing, or customer support roles
  • Strong negotiation skills to manage subscription renewals and contract discussions
  • Excellent analytical, organizational, and attention-to-detail abilities
  • Ability to adapt, multitask, and manage deadlines in a dynamic, fast-paced environment
  • Strong communication skills, including providing and receiving constructive feedback
  • Positive, proactive attitude with a passion for supporting nonprofit organizations
  • Willingness to learn and integrate AI tools responsibly to improve operational efficiency


Preferred Qualifications:

  • Intermediate to advanced Excel skills, including pivot tables, VLOOKUP, and data visualizations
  • Experience with subscription billing platforms


Benefits

  • Health & Wellness: Generous health, dental, and vision insurance options, plus access to 24/7 telehealth services
  • Time Off: Competitive PTO package with 20 PTO days, 3 flex days, 4 volunteer days, 12 paid holidays, and paid parental leave
  • Retirement: 401(k) with company match to help plan for your future
  • Equipment: All necessary tools and equipment shipped directly to your home
  • Compensation: Salary range $48,000-$72,000 with eligibility for discretionary bonus, based on experience, skills, and location
  • Work Environment: Fully remote position, with optional in-office work available for employees in Indianapolis, IN

Jobgether is a Talent Matching Platform that partners with companies worldwide to efficiently connect top talent with the right opportunities through AI-driven job matching.

When you apply, your profile goes through our AI-powered screening process designed to identify top talent efficiently and fairly.

🔍 Our AI evaluates your CV and LinkedIn profile thoroughly, analyzing your skills, experience, and achievements.

📊 It compares your profile to the job's core requirements and past success factors to determine your match score.

🎯 Based on this analysis, we automatically shortlist the 3 candidates with the highest match to the role.

🧠 When necessary, our human team may perform an additional manual review to ensure no strong profile is missed.

The process is transparent, skills-based, and free of bias—focusing solely on your fit for the role. Once the shortlist is completed, it is shared directly with the company that owns the job opening. Their internal hiring team then makes the final decision and handles next steps, such as interviews or assessments.

Thank you for your interest!

title: Application Production Support
descriptionHtml:
The Application Production Support specialist is a vital member of the IT Support US Equity team, providing both operational and project-related support for Sophis Equities. This role focuses on IT topics, projects, and systems utilized globally by the business line, with support primarily during US business hours.


Essential Duties and Responsibilities

  • Manage daily application issues and requests from Sophis Equities users.
  • Monitor end-of-day processes and batch jobs during office hours.
  • Provide Level 1 and Level 2 technical support; functional support experience is a plus.
  • Work morning US IT shifts to ensure the accessibility of Sophis Equities. Shift start times vary weekly at 6:00 AM, 7:00 AM, or 8:00 AM EST.
  • Communicate and report issues or problems related to the equity perimeter.
  • Develop and maintain tools to enhance end-user service levels and facilitate support tasks.
  • Assist Business Analysts in automating recurring requests.
  • Perform non-regression testing.
  • Ensure the smooth operation of one or more applications from start to finish, including daily monitoring, organizing maintenance work, and implementing upgrades.
  • Contribute to the implementation of projects within the corresponding community.
  • Plan and deploy new releases in production.
  • Provide support for weekend deliveries and target days as needed.


Qualifications

  • Bachelor’s degree in a relevant field.
  • 2 to 5 years of experience in an application support role.
  • Excellent application support skills with Sophis Equities.
  • Strong knowledge of the banking IT environment.
  • Ability to work effectively under stress.
  • Strong communication skills.
  • Team player with professionalism, availability, autonomy, and rigor.
  • Proactive approach to incident remediation and continuous improvement/automation.
  • Experience with middleware tools such as Ctrl-M, Zabbix, XLDeploy, Grid Computing (Datasynapse, in-house), and MQ.
  • Proficiency in scripting languages, including Python, PowerShell, and Shell.
  • Familiarity with operating systems such as Windows Server and UNIX.
  • Knowledge of relational database management systems (RDBMS) including Oracle, SQL Server, and Sybase ASE.
  • Proficient in written and spoken English.



Natixis is an equal opportunity employer, committed to a workplace free of discrimination. Natixis will not tolerate any form of discrimination based on age, color, mental or physical handicap or disability, pregnancy, marital status, sexual orientation, national origin, alienage, ancestry or citizenship status, race, religion, sex (including sex stereotyping, gender identity, gender expression or transgender status), veteran status, creed, genetic information or carrier status, or any other protected characteristic as established by law.


Respect for all means that we deal with each person as an individual and not as a member of any group. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment. Management is expected to provide leadership in supporting the firms EEO program by taking steps to promote EEO in all facets of employment including recruitment, hiring, retention, promotion, performance assessment, and career-development opportunities.


The salary range for the Associate position will be between $120,000 - 150,000. Natixis is required by law to include a reasonable estimate of the compensation range for this role. Actual base salary will vary and will be based on several factors including, but not limited to, relevant experience, education, skills set, applicable licensure and certifications, and other business and organizational needs. Base salary is only one component of our total rewards package. Natixis also offers a generous benefits package, and you may be eligible for a discretionary incentive award depending on company and individual performance.

title: Automation Project Management and Engineering
descriptionHtml:
Company Description

EAC Project Solutions LLC specializes in project management and engineering for manufacturing, automation, in the pharmaceutical industry. With decades of experience, we deliver successful projects in today's challenging environment. Our team is diverse, utilizing traditional, and Agile methodologies.


Role Description

This is a full-time hybrid role for Automation Project Managers and Engineers located in US, with some work-from-home flexibility. The Automation Project resources will be responsible for designing and implementing process automation, troubleshooting issues, developing and executing test cases, and ensuring quality assurance. The role involves coordinating with various departments to deliver seamless automation solutions and maintaining project documentation.


Qualifications

  • Skills in Process Automation and Automation
  • Experience with Troubleshooting and developing Test Cases
  • Proficiency in Quality Assurance practices
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities
  • Effective communication and teamwork skills
  • Bachelor's degree in engineering, Computer Science, or related field
  • Previous experience in manufacturing or related industries is a plus
  • Rockwell Automation Experience
  • DeltaV experience

title: Artificial Intelligence Engineer
descriptionHtml:
AI Engineer in Pheonix AZ

Contract: 6+ months


Job Description:

3-5 years of hands-on experience in AI engineering or related fields

· Proven ability to lead cross-functional engineering teams and deliver AI solutions aligned with business goals

· Hands-on experience with LLM fine-tuning, deep learning, vector databases, RAG, and agentic AI architectures

· Skilled in building and deploying AI-powered applications with seamless integrations across Azure and Oracle Cloud platforms

· Hands-on experience with end-to-end ML workflows, reusable patterns

· Experience with Copilot Studio, Microsoft 365 Copilot, and Semantic Kernel for enterprise AI productivity solutions

· Advanced proficiency in Python, JavaScript, and frameworks such as Node.js, React.js, and Next.js

· Proficient in Model Context Protocol (MCP) for scalable multi-agent communication

· Experience designing and deploying AI-powered chatbots and virtual assistants

· Strong understanding of CI/CD practices, containerization, and infrastructure automation with tools like Azure DevOps, Docker, RedHat OpenShift, Ansible, and Terraform

· Knowledge of embeddings, multi-modal AI, autonomous agentic systems, and data engineering basics

· Skilled in chat bot lifecycle management.

· Experience with data connectors, API gateways, and cloud-native services such as API Gateway, CloudFront, and S3

· Committed to responsible AI development with background in AI ethics, governance, and model transparency

· Strong communicator with the ability to translate complex AI capabilities into strategic value for stakeholders

· Experience working in agile, collaborative teams

· Strong problem-solving skills and adaptability to evolving technologies

title: Application Engineer
descriptionHtml:
Krueger, an Air Distribution Technologies, Inc. subsidiary, is seeking an Application Engineer I to support their Terminal Unit customers and sales teams. The Application Engineer manages client relationships for the Krueger brand through answering technical questions regarding Terminal Unit products and determining feasibility of custom product requests. The Application Engineer will utilize Krueger specific literature and SolidWorks 3-D modeling software to develop custom products and ensure customer satisfaction.


What You'll Do:

  • Provide technical assistance to customers and manufacturing engineers at the production facilities regarding HVAC products, including terminal units, fan coils, and blower coils, along with other Krueger air distribution products.
  • Manage projects under direct supervision of the Product Application Manager and support new product initiatives by identifying industry needs, idea/concept input, review of drawings, and technical feedback.
  • Conduct technical trainings in person or via a webinar to customers on proper use of the products.
  • Provide technical training on Kreuger's product selection software.
  • Process quotes, orders, and shipment data for special products, while developing strong business relationships with vendors and plants.
  • Assist with maintaining product specific literature and developing technical marketing content.


What You'll Bring:

  • Bachelor's Degree from an accredited four-year College or University in Engineering.
  • 1+ years work experience with SolidWorks
  • Excellent interpersonal skills and flexibility to work on multiple projects and assignments is critical.
  • Must be willing to travel up to 10% of the time to respective manufacturing plants or customer representative offices for training or product audits.
  • Proficiency using MS Excel, MS Word, and MS PowerPoint.

Preferred:

  • HVAC experience/knowledge.
  • Experience working in a customer facing position.


Work Environment:

The work environment is primarily in a professional office setting with standard office equipment and a climate-controlled, atmosphere designed for productivity. There may be occasional opportunities to visit a lab or plant for meetings or collaboration. Reasonable accommodations may be made for individuals with disabilities.


Equal Opportunity Employer:

Air Distribution Technologies, Inc. is an equal employment opportunity and affirmative action employer. We welcome all qualified applicants, regardless of race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, veteran status, or disability. For more information, please view EEO is the Law.

title: .NET SDET
descriptionHtml:
.NET SDET
Contract to Hire (W2 ONLY, NO C-C)
Irving, TX (Hybrid)

MUST BE ABLE TO READ AND WRITE .NET CODE!!!

 Job Responsibilities
Design, develop and maintain automation tests written in C# for client-server applications.
Work collaboratively with scrum teams and product owners to identify test cases to automate.
Coordinate with scrum teams to report test failures.
Communicate test progress, results, testing metrics and issues to key stakeholders.
Support ongoing work to continuously improve test automation processes and frameworks.

Requirements
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering or a related field.
3 to 5 years in a QA automation role.
Experience working in an agile environment. (Scrum, Kanban, etc.)
Excellent oral and written communication skills to interact effectively with various teams and management group.
Ability to solve complex problems, including use of research, analysis and expertise to develop creative, innovative solutions.
Object-oriented programming using C# in Visual Studio IDE.
Test automation frameworks. (such as WinAppDriver, TestStack White, Selenium)
Test case and build management tools. (preferably TFS)
Version control systems. (preferably Git or TFVS)
SQL Server. (complex joins, inserts, updates)
Automated testing of client-server applications.
API testing.

Estimated Min Rate: $45.00
Estimated Max Rate: $55.00


Note: Any pay ranges displayed are estimations. Actual pay is determined by an applicant's experience, technical expertise, and other qualifications as listed in the job description. All qualified applicants are welcome to apply.

Yoh, a Day & Zimmermann company, is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran.

Visit https://www.yoh.com/applicants-with-disabilities to contact us if you are an individual with a disability and require accommodation in the application process.

For California applicants, qualified applicants with arrest or conviction records will be considered for employment in accordance with the Los Angeles County Fair Chance Ordinance for Employers and the California Fair Chance Act. All of the material job duties described in this posting are job duties for which a criminal history may have a direct, adverse, and negative relationship, potentially resulting in the withdrawal of a conditional offer of employment.

All qualified applicants are welcome to apply.Yoh, a Day & Zimmermann company, is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran.Visit https://www.yoh.com/applicants-with-disabilities to contact us if you are an individual with a disability and require accommodation in the application process.For California applicants, qualified applicants with arrest or conviction records will be considered for employment in accordance with the Los Angeles County Fair Chance Ordinance for Employers and the California Fair Chance Act. All of the material job duties described in this posting are job duties for which a criminal history may have a direct, adverse, and negative relationship, potentially resulting in the withdrawal of a conditional offer of employment.

title: Reporting Engineer
descriptionHtml:
At Futurety, we believe data and technology can solve the world’s biggest problems.


We are a Data Visualization, Analytics, and Digital Marketing consulting firm that does far more interesting work than the above line could ever describe. We’re proud to partner with a wide range of clients—from startups to Fortune 500 companies to government agencies—helping them turn data into insights and action. Now, we’re looking for a Reporting Engineer to join our team and take our analytics reporting to the next level.


In this role, you’ll:

Work with both our internal team and external clients to build, manage, and automate dynamic reporting solutions that translate digital marketing performance into clear, actionable insights. This is an ideal role for a professional with 2+ years of experience in analytics, data engineering, or marketing data roles, with a passion for automation and data storytelling


Key Responsibilities and Skills:

  • Manage and maintain reporting solutions for digital marketing clients across paid media and SEO
  • Build and automate dashboards using Looker Studio, Power BI, Tableau, or similar tools
  • Use Python, R, and/or SQL to manipulate and transform marketing data from multiple sources
  • Integrate campaign data from Google Ads, Meta Ads, and other digital platforms via APIs or cloud-based data warehouses (e.g., BigQuery)
  • Use large language models (LLMs) to generate insights, commentary, and summaries for reports
  • Ensure all reports are timely, accurate, and aligned with client KPIs
  • Collaborate closely with strategists and marketers to understand reporting needs and evolve solutions over time
  • Continuously look for opportunities to automate, optimize, and scale reporting processes
  • Support our collaborative, energized internal team dynamic


Qualifications:

  • A kind, collaborative attitude
  • A desire to learn and grow—whether it’s a new BI tool, marketing platform, or AI technique
  • 2+ years of experience in analytics, reporting, or data engineering, ideally in a marketing environment
  • Working knowledge of Python, R, and/or SQL for data processing and automation
  • Experience using Looker Studio, Power BI, Tableau, or similar BI platforms
  • Familiarity with Google Ads, Meta Ads, and common marketing metrics (CTR, CPA, ROAS, etc.)
  • Experience with Google BigQuery or similar cloud data warehouses
  • Experience using LLMs or generative AI tools to support reporting or insight generation
  • Detail oriented, rigorous, and thorough; focused on getting every data point right


Bonus Points For:

  • Working knowledge/ experience with digital media buys (Google Ads, Meta Ads)
  • Experience working in an agency or consulting setting
  • Experience with version control (Git) and/or cloud functions
  • Familiarity with GA4, SEO tools, or tag management platforms
  • Creative problem-solver with a strong sense of data visualization best practices


Why Futurety?

  • Competitive salary and benefits package.
  • Opportunities for professional growth and development.
  • Collaborative and innovative work environment.
  • Work on exciting projects with leading clients across various industries.
  • Supportive team culture that values work-life balance.


If you are passionate about managing technical projects and have a knack for data analytics, we would love to hear from you. Apply today and join our team at Futurety!


How to Apply:

Please submit your resume and a cover letter detailing your relevant experience and why you are interested in this position to careers@futurety.com.


Futurety is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment where everyone feels valued, respected, and empowered to succeed. We offer competitive pay and exceptional benefits for full time employees:


  • Excellent health insurance
  • Company paid vision insurance
  • Company paid dental insurance
  • Matching 401(k)
  • Family friendly flex time
  • Pet friendly office
  • Profit sharing
  • Generous vacation and time off
  • A strict “life is too short rule” – your teammates will be as talented, smart and humble as you are and your clients will treat you like part of their teams.


Job Type:

  • Full-time


Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift


Supplemental pay types:

  • Bonus pay
  • Commission pay


Ability to commute/relocate:

  • Columbus, OH 43220: Reliably commute or planning to relocate before starting work (Required)


Work Location:

  • In person

title: Canada IT Project Manager and Generalist -  100% Remote
descriptionHtml:
Do you love:

  • Figuring out tricky problems?
  • Finding ways to improve processes?
  • Endless learning opportunities?

If so, this is the opportunity for you!

BooksTime is looking for a creative, resourceful IT Project Manager and Generalist to join our growing team.

This role offers:

  • Flexible hours
  • 100% remote work
  • Friendly & supportive colleagues
  • Significant opportunities for advancement

This position could be a great fit for a highly ambitious individual early in their career.

Who We Are:

BooksTime is an ambitious, innovative accounting & bookkeeping startup with teams in 5 countries. BooksTime was founded in 2016 and we've been continually growing since. For more information, check out our website: bookstime.com.

Why Join BooksTime?

  • Make history. Our startup is still fairly small, but we have big plans to disrupt the accounting industry. This is a great opportunity to get in early at a startup that, we believe, is on its way to becoming an industry leader.
  • Do work that matters. The projects you will be working on will be critical to the success of the company, our mission to modernize the accounting industry, the daily work of your colleagues and the hundreds of small businesses we serve.
  • Grow with the company. As our company continues to grow, there will be many opportunities to take on new responsibilities and grow professionally.
  • Professional development. You'll get access to various cybersecurity certification courses as part of this role.
  • Constant Improvement. One of our core values at BooksTime is Constant Improvement. We are always pushing to do better, from thinking of new ways to "wow" our clients to discovering opportunities to make internal processes more efficient. Our goal is to become the #1 bookkeeping firm in the country -- and our relentless focus on Constant Improvement is what will get us there. Every member of our team plays a role, and you will have an especially big role to play in this position. We can't wait to hear your ideas about how we can do better. If you're looking for a role that gives you ample opportunity to make a big impact -- you've found it!

What You'll Do:

As BooksTime has grown, so have our IT needs. Therefore, we’re looking to expand our IT department, which currently includes 3 full-time staff.

The role includes 3 main functions:

  • Support & Routine Operations, i.e. responding to helpdesk support tickets from other employees, managing staff access and accounts in company systems when team members are onboarded or offboarded, and more. Our staff use over 20 different apps and systems and require a wide range of support.
  • Technical Project Management, i.e. working on initiatives to improve our IT systems. This includes automation projects, internal software development, efforts to improve efficiency and cost-effectiveness, and finding ways to increase the user-friendliness of our internal systems.
  • Security Assurance, i.e. enhancing security measures to protect our company, staff and clients, monitoring for threats and leading responses to them, staying abreast of the latest in cybersecurity technology, improving policies & procedures, providing training to our staff, and more.

The exact scope of the role will be shaped around the strengths of the person we hire. You might focus on one of the 3 functions above more than the others, depending on where you have the most experience.

Supervisory Role:

This role is suitable for an early-career candidate. However, more experienced candidates would be eligible for a more advanced version of this role, which would involve supervising other IT staff and leading larger, more complex initiatives.

Whether you’re in the supervisory role or not, we really value your ideas and input on everything that we do.

Requirements

  • An adaptable, fast learner. We need someone who feels very comfortable diving in and figuring things out. If you are happiest maintaining a well-established process that someone else designed, this is NOT the ideal role for you. If you love looking for creative solutions to new problems, you could be a perfect fit! For this sort of work, there's sometimes no playbook, no step-by-step instructions available. New challenges arise all the time. The work is all about investigating and figuring out each problem, finding creative solutions, and also thinking about ways to head off similar problems in the future.
  • Comfortable working mostly independently. There are always people who are happy and eager to help you brainstorm, but there's often nobody else who already knows the answer to some types of questions that come up. Often, someone just has to dive in and figure it out.
  • Organized, with good project management skills. You’re great at staying on top of things, planning out complex projects, prioritizing tasks, and meeting deadlines.
  • Strong communication skills: You’ll be supporting many colleagues who don’t have an IT background, so you’ll need to be comfortable explaining IT topics to non-technical colleagues. You may also occasionally need to communicate with external parties (clients or partners) via email, which requires a high level of professional written communication skills.
  • Comfort with evolving job functions. The core focus of this role will always be IT and security. However, as our company continues to grow, the IT and security needs of the company will continue to evolve, so your exact duties and focus area may change from time to time.

Preferred (But Not Required):

  • 3+ years of experience in IT management, product/project management, or software development.
  • A security clearance (strongly preferred).
  • Familiarity with security best practices and systems compliance.
  • Cybersecurity certification (none are required, but any of these would be a plus: CEH, GSEC, GMOB, GCFA, CISA, CISM, Comp TIA Security+ or CySA+, CISSP, SSCP, ECSA, LPT, etc.)

Benefits

Salary Range: Highly dependent on knowledge level, education and location.

  • For less experienced candidates, the range is approx. $20 to $30 per hour.
  • For more experienced candidates, especially those that would join in a supervisory role, higher amounts may be discussed.

Additional bonuses are possible based on performance.

Benefits Include:

  • Flexible schedule;
  • Work from home (we are big believers in remote work!);
  • Health insurance reimbursement plan (a QSEHRA plan);
  • Professional development assistance;
  • Simple IRA with employer matching after 2 years;
  • Flexible Paid Time Off (PTO) starting at 20 days for full-time employees.

Other Details:

Time Zones - IMPORTANT: You will need availability each weekday around 9-11am Eastern Time. The rest of your schedule can be more flexible.

Full-Time/Part-Time: We prefer folks who will start part-time and transition to full-time after at least 1 month. However, it may be possible to start full-time from the beginning.

Keywords: IT, Information Technology, Technical Support, Helpdesk, Troubleshooting, InfoSec, Information Security, Cyber, Cybersecurity, Cyber Security, IT Project Manager, Tech Lead, Support, Security Clearance.

title: Salesforce Operations & Reporting Associate
descriptionHtml:
Salesforce Operations & Reporting Associate

Location: New York, NY | Hybrid


About M Science

M Science is a data-driven research and analytics firm, uncovering new insights for leading financial institutions and corporations. M Science is revolutionizing research, discovering new data sets and pioneering methodologies to provide actionable intelligence. Our research teams have decades of experience working with massive amounts of unstructured data in near real-time to discern critical insights that help clients make smarter, more informed decisions. We combine the best of finance, data and technology to create a truly unique value proposition for both financial services firms and major corporations.


M Science was founded as Majestic Research in 2002 and in 2016 was spun out to form M Science, a portfolio company of Leucadia National Corporation, a division of Jefferies Financial Group Inc. (NYSE:JEF).


Position Summary

We are looking for a motivated and detail-oriented Salesforce Operations & Reporting Associate to join our team. This role is ideal for someone who is eager to learn and grow in the areas of CRM systems, reporting, and business operations. You will support the day-to-day management of Salesforce, help maintain clean and accurate data, and assist with reporting and workflow improvements across teams.


Key Responsibilities

Salesforce Support & Maintenance

  • Help update case layouts, queues, and views to improve usability.
  • Assist in creating and maintaining reports and dashboards.
  • Support the creation of custom fields and objects for better reporting.
  • Maintain a local knowledge base within Salesforce.
  • Track incidents and help manage outbound call and meeting logs.

Reporting & Data Analysis

  • Build and update basic reports and dashboards.
  • Respond to ad hoc reporting requests with guidance.
  • Help clean up outdated or unused reports.

Operational & Workflow Support

  • Work with teams to improve internal workflows and data collection processes.
  • Assist with manual data validation and Excel-based tasks.
  • Maintain product lists and check CRM data for accuracy.
  • Support monthly tasks like allocations and commissions tracking.

Training & Documentation

  • Help train users on Salesforce basics and internal processes.
  • Assist in documenting workflows and best practices.

User Access & Provisioning

  • Add new users and remove departing employees from Salesforce and connected tools.
  • Help manage user roles and permissions.

Quality Assurance & Metadata Accuracy

  • Maintain databases and company records, ensuring accuracy and consistency across teams and systems.
  • Help review KPI submissions and troubleshoot issues.
  • Support improvements to internal reporting and API workflows.


Qualifications

  • 1-3 years of experience in a CRM, operations, or reporting role (internships or coursework welcome).
  • Basic understanding of Salesforce or other CRM platforms (training will be provided).
  • Strong attention to detail and willingness to learn.
  • Comfortable working with Excel and basic data tools.
  • Good communication and problem-solving skills.

Nice to Have

  • Familiarity with Salesforce Reports and Dashboards.
  • SQL experience.
  • Exposure to automation tools like Salesforce Flows.
  • Interest in business intelligence or data analysis.


Primary Location: New York, NY

Salary Range: $85,000-$105,000 USD/Annual


The salary offered will take into consideration an individual’s experience level and qualifications. In addition to salary, M Science offers, for eligible employees, an annual discretionary incentive bonus, competitive employee benefits, including: medical, dental & vision coverage; 401(k); life, accident, disability insurance; and wellness programs. M Science also offers paid time off packages that include planned time off (vacation), unplanned time off (sick leave), paid holidays and paid parental leave.

industries: Capital Markets, Market Research, and Financial Services

title: Operations Consultant
descriptionHtml:
December Entry


Who We Are

Streamliners is a management consulting firm specializing in rapid efficiency improvements, operational excellence, and fast turnarounds. We assist manufacturers and private equity-owned portfolio companies in North America and Europe in solving complex operational challenges to maximize profit margins and gain a competitive edge. At our core, we are doers, collaborating closely with clients across various industries to execute the steps necessary for performance improvements.


Who You Are

You are a self-directed, goal-oriented problem solver and a champion of change management. You excel in both team settings and autonomous environments, going the extra mile with your entrepreneurial drive and intellectual curiosity. Your track record of achievement reflects your goal-focused, self-starting nature, always seeking feedback to grow personally and professionally.


The Role

You will work alongside other consultants and clients, typically on-site, to achieve transformation objectives. Your responsibilities include supporting workstreams and executing effective improvement plans within operations, from shop floor enhancements to fundamental changes in work processes and information and material flows. You will build relationships with both shop floor operators and C-suite executives to drive change and support client and internal teams in turnarounds, transformations, and expansions.


You should feel comfortable conducting the following analysis with light support and direction:

  • Process Capacity & Utilization Modeling
  • Bottleneck Analysis
  • Waste Reduction
  • Warehouse Restructuring
  • KPI Creation
  • Root Cause Analysis
  • Workforce Analysis



Duties / Responsibilities:

  • Support project managers and taking ownership for project workstreams, transformations, and turnarounds
  • Problem-solve technical manufacturing issues using structured methodologies
  • Use facts and data to prioritize improvement opportunities
  • You will adopt a process-oriented approach to solving problems and will break a large complex problem into a series of smaller, more manageable modules.
  • You will need to cultivate strong relationships where everyone around you feels respected and valued.
  • Execute project related tasks to drive change and improvements to the overall execution of client operations
  • Recommend actions and help clients implement them


Required Qualifications:

  • 2+ years of experience in a high-performance manufacturing or consulting environment
  • Bachelor’s degree (Master’s preferred) in STEM (Science, Technology, Engineering and Mathematics)
  • Functional knowledge in one or more of the following: Lean Manufacturing, project management, process automation, continuous improvement
  • Ability to work effectively and collaboratively with people at all levels in an organization
  • Strong communication and organizational skills
  • Willingness to travel +80%


Preferred:

  • Experience in Lean Six Sigma (Green Belt is a plus) and methodologies including but not limited to Kaizen methods, JIT, Kanban, SMED, 5S, Poka Yoke, Visual Workplace, and VSM
  • Consulting experience or operations leadership – ideally with a focus on operations, manufacturing, supply chain, or complex programs.


Compensation: $135,000+ annually

Travel Required: +80%

You will build relationships with both shop floor operators and C-suite executives to drive change and support client and internal teams in turnarounds, transformations, and expansions.You should feel comfortable conducting the following analysis with light support and direction:Process Capacity & Utilization ModelingBottleneck AnalysisWaste ReductionWarehouse RestructuringKPI CreationRoot Cause AnalysisWorkforce AnalysisDuties / Responsibilities:Support project managers and taking ownership for project workstreams, transformations, and turnaroundsProblem-solve technical manufacturing issues using structured methodologiesUse facts and data to prioritize improvement opportunitiesYou will adopt a process-oriented approach to solving problems and will break a large complex problem into a series of smaller, more manageable modules.You will need to cultivate strong relationships where everyone around you feels respected and valued.Execute project related tasks to drive change and improvements to the overall execution of client operationsRecommend actions and help clients implement themRequired Qualifications:2+ years of experience in a high-performance manufacturing or consulting environmentBachelor’s degree (Master’s preferred) in STEM (Science, Technology, Engineering and Mathematics)Functional knowledge in one or more of the following: Lean Manufacturing, project management, process automation, continuous improvementAbility to work effectively and collaboratively with people at all levels in an organizationStrong communication and organizational skillsWillingness to travel +80%Preferred:Experience in Lean Six Sigma (Green Belt is a plus) and methodologies including but not limited to Kaizen methods, JIT, Kanban, SMED, 5S, Poka Yoke, Visual Workplace, and VSMConsulting experience or operations leadership – ideally with a focus on operations, manufacturing, supply chain, or complex programs.Compensation: $135,000+ annuallyTravel Required: +80%

title: Customer Success Manager
descriptionHtml:
Who Connecteam is:

Connecteam is a TLV-based startup that's on a mission to change the work experience for 80% of the world's global workforce - the deskless employees.

Our business management platform helps thousands of businesses thrive by taking away the daily hustle and complexities of managing teams, so they can have the peace of mind to grow and run their business.

About the role:

The Customer Success Manager is responsible for managing a high-volume portfolio of low-touch mid-market and SMB customers in the US. This role focuses on proactive engagement at scale, ensuring customers achieve their business goals while maximizing the value of their Connecteam investment.

The ideal candidate has experience in digital-first customer success, leveraging automation, data analytics, and tech-touch strategies to drive adoption, retention, and expansion at scale. They should be comfortable handling a large portfolio, and balancing one-to-many outreach with personalized engagement where needed.

This is a fully remote position.

Your main responsibilities will include:

  • Scalable Customer Engagement: Manage a large portfolio of mid-market and SMB customers, using automation, webinars, in-app messaging, and other digital strategies to drive adoption and retention.
  • Proactive Lifecycle Management: Guide customers through adoption, and renewal phases using data-driven insights and segmentation-based engagement.
  • Customer Health Monitoring: Analyze customer health scores, usage data, and churn risk indicators to proactively intervene when needed.
  • Expansion & Growth: Identify upsell and cross-sell opportunities by leveraging customer data and strategic outreach in collaboration with the sales team.
  • Escalation Management: Support customers who require higher-touch interventions, escalating to the appropriate teams when necessary.
  • Work with customers to create new use cases/success stories

Which qualifications you'll need:

  • 2+ years of B2B SaaS experience in Customer Success, Scale CS, and Account Management – MUST
  • Experience managing a high-volume portfolio (100+ accounts) using tech-touch & automation – MUST
  • Proven ability to drive engagement and retention through digital programs, webinars, and self-service content
  • Strong analytical skills, with experience using data to segment customers and trigger proactive outreach
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills, including experience with one-to-many communication strategies
  • A team player who enjoys getting and providing feedback, sharing ideas, and constantly improving together
  • Ability to work independently in a fast-paced, high-growth environment, balancing multiple initiatives at once
  • Experience collaborating with global teams across different time zones
  • A growth mindset with a passion for continuously improving customer experience at scale
  • Background in HR Tech, Workforce Management, or related industries - An Advantage Benefits:
    • Medical coverage.
    • Insurance plan.
    • Paid time off for vacation, sick days.
Salary range: 90K-100K

We are accepting applications from employees working in the following states: Texas, New York, South Carolina, North Carolina, Colorado, Florida, Utah, and Georgia.

Joining Connecteam Is The Smart Move:

  • We build our people up. Every team member is treated as a long-term investment and we recognize the value in always nurturing and training them so they can go above and beyond in their skills and job duties.
  • We make an impact on our customer's business. We are on a mission to provide managers of all business types and sizes with the tools they need to communicate, operate, engage, and run their deskless workforce. Our product offers them an effective and affordable solution to run their business.
  • We get the job done. Connecteam employees are passionate in executing their job duties so they can drive the company forward and provide real value to our customers.
  • We have fun! From weekly happy hours to holiday parties, we always enjoy each other's company (and good food, of course). Connecteam is like one big, happy family!
  • Everyone is welcome. Connecteam is committed to building an encouraging, caring, and supportive environment. We share a responsibility to support our team and enrich their lives.

Together we will shape the future of work!

Our privacy policy
