title: Healthcare Interface Specialist (Remote)
descriptionHtml:
Competitive Compensation & Benefits Package!

Position eligible for –

  • Annual incentive bonus plan
  • Medical, dental, and vision insurance with low deductible/low cost health plan
  • Generous vacation and sick time accrual
  • 12 paid holidays
  • State Retirement (pension plan)
  • 401(k) Plan with employer match
  • Company paid life and disability insurance
  • Wellness Programs
  • Public Service Loan Forgiveness Qualifying Employer

See attachment for additional details.

Office Location: Remote option; Available for any of Partners' NC locations

Closing Date: Open Until Filled

Primary Purpose of Position: The Healthcare Interface Specialist plays a key role in ensuring seamless data exchange across disparate healthcare systems, directly supporting operational efficiency and patient care. This position is responsible for the continuous monitoring, maintenance, and optimization of system interfaces, working closely with internal teams, external partners, and third-party vendors throughout all project phases, including planned upgrades. The role also contributes to project management efforts, ensuring timelines and deliverables are met, while applying industry best practices and established procedures to maintain a secure, reliable, and high-performing healthcare IT environment.

We’re looking for a dynamic candidate who brings energy and enthusiasm to their work, thrives on innovation, and is deeply passionate about driving impactful results.

Role And Responsibilities

Interface Management and Optimization

  • Monitor, maintain, and continuously optimize healthcare system interfaces to ensure accurate, timely, and secure bi-directional data exchange
  • Proactively identify performance bottlenecks and implement solutions to enhance throughput and reduce latency
  • Establish and maintain interface monitoring dashboards with real-time alerts for system anomalies

Data Integration and Quality Assurance

  • Ensure data exchanged between systems is properly formatted, validated, translated, and mapped to maintain accuracy and clinical meaning across all platforms
  • Implement data quality checks and validation rules to prevent corrupt or incomplete data transmission
  • Design and maintain complex data transformation logic for disparate system architectures

System Lifecycle Support

  • Lead interface components of planned system upgrades, migrations, and enhancements while minimizing downtime and service disruption
  • Develop comprehensive rollback plans and contingency procedures for critical system changes
  • Coordinate interface testing during system maintenance windows and planned outages

Advanced Troubleshooting

  • Diagnose complex interface issues using advanced monitoring tools, log analysis, and system tracing capabilities
  • Conduct thorough root cause analysis of system failures and implement both immediate fixes and long-term preventive measures
  • Maintain detailed incident response procedures and escalation protocols

24/7 Operational Support

  • Provide responsive after-hours on-call support to diagnose and resolve critical system issues affecting patient care operations
  • Execute emergency response procedures for interface failures impacting clinical workflows
  • Coordinate with vendor support teams during critical incidents requiring immediate resolution

Collaboration and Empowerment

  • Collaborate with state agencies, regulatory bodies, business stakeholders, internal IT teams, and third-party vendors throughout all phases of complex interface projects
  • Facilitate requirements gathering sessions with clinical end-users to ensure technical solutions meet operational needs
  • Serve as technical liaison between business units and development teams

Requirements and Documentation Management

  • Gather, analyze, and document comprehensive technical and functional requirements, defining clear project scope, objectives, and success criteria
  • Create and maintain detailed interface specifications, data mapping documents, and system architecture diagrams
  • Develop user-friendly documentation for operational procedures and troubleshooting guides

Change Management Excellence

  • Follow and enhance established change management processes for all break/fix activities, system modifications, and new implementations
  • Maintain detailed change logs and configuration management documentation

Regulatory Compliance

  • Ensure strict adherence to HIPAA, HITECH, state privacy regulations, and organizational security policies for all integration activities
  • Conduct regular assessments of interface connections and data transmission methods
  • Implement and maintain audit trails for all data exchanges and system modifications

Standards Implementation

  • Stay current with evolving healthcare interoperability standards (HL7 v2.x, HL7 FHIR, X12 EDI) and proactively incorporate them into interface solutions

Training and Mentorship

  • Develop and deliver comprehensive training programs for internal staff on interface technologies and operational procedures

Continuous Improvement

  • Incorporate Artificial Intelligence (AI) to envision and drive innovation
  • Apply industry best practices and emerging technologies to enhance system reliability, performance, and interoperability
  • Conduct regular system performance reviews and recommend optimization strategies
  • Research and evaluate new integration platforms and tools for potential organizational benefit

Leadership and Communication

  • Participate in cross-functional project teams through complex interface implementations and system integrations
  • Manage project timelines, track milestones, and ensure deliverable deadlines are met while maintaining quality standards
  • Successfully balance and prioritize multiple concurrent initiatives while maintaining attention to detail
  • Communicate complex technical concepts clearly and effectively to diverse audiences including executives, managers, clinical staff, and technical teams
  • Foster a collaborative, positive work environment that promotes innovation and continuous learning
  • Maintain professional relationships built on trust, reliability, and technical expertise with customers, colleagues, and management
  • Demonstrate adaptability and resilience when managing competing priorities and urgent requests
  • Subject matter expert for interface technologies
  • Support organizational disaster recovery and business continuity planning efforts
  • Perform other related duties as assigned to support departmental and organizational objectives

Knowledge, Skills And Abilities

  • Strong working knowledge of healthcare software integration using HL7, FHIR, JSON, XML, and related interoperability protocols or toolsets
  • Demonstrated expertise in diagnosing and resolving interface and system integration issues in live healthcare environments, with a focus on minimizing downtime, ensuring data accuracy, and maintaining compliance with privacy and security regulations
  • Hands-on experience with healthcare interface engines such as Mirth Connect/NextGen Connect, Rhapsody, or similar platforms
  • Familiarity with Managed File Transfer tools like Progress MOVEit Automation or equivalent solutions
  • Proficiency in writing and maintaining scripts using Python, JavaScript, PowerShell, or similar scripting languages
  • Hands-on experience with API’s enabling integration and sharing of healthcare data across disparate applications and systems.
  • Skilled in working with relational databases, including writing SQL queries, stored procedures, SSIS packages, and generating reports.
  • Knowledge of working with Microsoft Azure environments
  • Familiarity with Microsoft Windows 10, Windows Server 2019, Microsoft 365 (O365), and related administrative tools such as Remote Desktop, Computer Management, and Event Viewer
  • Strong verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to effectively engage providers, external partners, management, and end users
  • Team-oriented mindset with the ability to manage multiple tasks simultaneously and meet deadlines
  • Excellent time management and organizational skills. High attention to detail and accuracy in documentation and execution
  • Ability to identify opportunities for innovation and process improvement
  • Proven capability to implement solutions that enhance operational efficiency, system reliability, and user satisfaction

Education/Experience Required

  • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or a related field, or equivalent practical experience
  • At least 3 years of experience in healthcare IT, including system integration and interoperability standards
  • Minimum 3 years of hands-on experience with healthcare data exchange and interchanges
  • Solid understanding of healthcare interoperability standards such as HL7, FHIR, and X12
  • Proven ability to perform data mapping, transformation, and validation across disparate systems
  • Familiarity with secure data exchange protocols (e.g., VPN, SFTP, HTTPS) and regulatory compliance frameworks including HIPAA and HITECH

Licensure/Certification Requirements: N/A

title: Document Automation Procurement Specialist
descriptionHtml:
**Telework Eligible**

Yes

**Major Duties**

  • Serves as customer advocate for Document Services by providing customer service and marketing services to both internal and external customers
  • Utilizes printing management programs to prepare and manipulate digital files for output to various platforms to assist with customer's desktop publishing requests.
  • Furnishes technical advice regarding the preparation, design, layout, specifications, production and distribution method for complex publications, forms and specialty items from the original concept to the finished product
  • Reviews specifications and provides expert advice to ensure that final product or service meets expectations in terms of price, quality legality and timeliness.
  • Prepare orders for DLA Document Services in-house production and GPO procurement through GPO Express
  • Serves as liaison between the customer and GPO procurement officials when developing new specifications, distribution methods and geographic area for bid advertisement.

**Qualification Summary**

To qualify for a Document Automation Procurement Specialist, your resume and supporting documentation must support: A. Specialized Experience: One year of specialized experience that equipped you with the particular competencies to successfully perform the duties of the position and is directly in or related to this position. To qualify at the GS-07 level, applicants must possess one year of specialized experience equivalent to the GS-06 level or equivalent under other pay systems in the Federal service, military, or private sector. To qualify at the GS-09 level, applicants must possess one year of specialized experience equivalent to the GS-07 level or equivalent under other pay systems in the Federal service, military, or private sector. Applicants must meet eligibility requirements including time-in-grade (General Schedule (GS) positions only), time-after-competitive appointment, minimum qualifications, and any other regulatory requirements by the cut-off/closing date of the announcement. Creditable specialized experience includes: GS-07: With assistance, utilizes printing management programs and furnishes technical advice regarding the preparation, design, layout, specifications, production and distribution methods for complex publications, forms, and specialty items from the original concept to the finished product. GS-09: Serves as subject matter expert in utilizing printing management programs. Furnishes expert advice regarding the preparation, design, layout, specifications, production and distribution methods for complex publications, forms, and specialty items from the original concept to the finished product. B. Education Substitution: Such education must demonstrate the knowledge, skills, and abilities necessary to do the work. Education must be from a college or university accredited by an organization approved by the U.S. Department of Education. See http://ope.ed.gov/accreditation/Search.aspx. If using education to meet basic qualifications, YOU MUST SUBMIT A TRANSCRIPT as supplemental documentation. To qualify based on education in lieu of specialized experience, applicants must possess: GS-07: One (1) full year of graduate level education or superior academic achievement. GS-09: A master's or equivalent graduate degree, or 2 full years of progressively higher level graduate education leading to such a degree, or LLB. or J.D., if related. C. Combination: Combinations of successfully completed post-high school education and experience may be used to meet total qualification requirements for grade levels GS-09 and GS-07 and may be computed by first determining the applicant's total qualifying experience as a percentage of the experience required for the grade level; then determining the applicant's education as a percentage of the education required for the grade level; and then adding the two percentages. The total percentages must equal at least 100 percent to qualify an applicant for that grade level. Only graduate education in excess of the amount required for the next lower grade level may be used to qualify applicants for positions at grade GS-09. Experience refers to paid and unpaid experience, including volunteer work done through National Service programs (e.g., Peace Corps, AmeriCorps) and other organizations (e.g., professional, philanthropic, religious, spiritual, community, student, social). Volunteer work helps build critical competencies, knowledge, and skills and can provide valuable training and experience that translates directly to paid employment. You will receive credit for all qualifying experience, including volunteer experience.

title: Customer Support Specialist (New Grad)
descriptionHtml:
About Rippling

Rippling gives businesses one place to run HR, IT, and Finance. It brings together all of the workforce systems that are normally scattered across a company, like payroll, expenses, benefits, and computers. For the first time ever, you can manage and automate every part of the employee lifecycle in a single system.

Take onboarding, for example. With Rippling, you can hire a new employee anywhere in the world and set up their payroll, corporate card, computer, benefits, and even third-party apps like Slack and Microsoft 365—all within 90 seconds.

Based in San Francisco, CA, Rippling has raised $1.2B from the world’s top investors—including Kleiner Perkins, Founders Fund, Sequoia, Greenoaks, and Bedrock—and was named one of America's best startup employers by Forbes.

We prioritize candidate safety. Please be aware that official communication will only be sent from @Rippling.com addresses.

About The Role

We are building a world-class Support team - committed to helping customers realize the full potential of Rippling. Team members focus on getting our customers back on course when challenges arise and contribute to internal discussions around product enhancements. Our Support Organization is composed of product specific teams such as HR, IT and Finance.

If you are the type of person to look at a flight of 10,000 stairs, pause, get a bit excited, and then seize the moment - you have what it takes!

What You Will Do

  • Become a product expert - Maintain a high level of product knowledge to provide accurate information and assistance to both customers and your colleagues
  • Take charge of customer issues from start to finish, while working in a dynamic and fast-paced environment
  • Respond promptly and professionally to customer inquiries via email, chat, or video conferencing
  • Resolve product or service issues by understanding the customer's complaint, determining the cause of the problem, selecting and explaining the best solution, and following up to ensure resolution.
  • Document and track customer interactions, transactions, comments, and complaints using the company's CRM system
  • Gather customer feedback and work directly with Product and Engineering teams to share insights to help improve products and services.
  • Stay up-to-date with company policies, procedures, and product updates to provide accurate and consistent information to customers
  • Work well under time constraints and meet schedules; at times with unexpected deadlines, to ensure client’s needs are met.
  • Deliver exceptional service and ensure customer satisfaction by going the extra mile in every interaction.

What You Will Need

  • Required: Must be located in PST or MDT
  • Ability to work 9am-5:30pm PST
  • Required: Bachelor's degree obtained within the last 12 months
  • Required: Proficient in English; written and verbal communication skills
  • Demonstrated experience problem-solving with attention to detail
  • Organizational skills and experience improving processes
  • Flexibility with changing job duties and responsibilities
  • Time management skills and ability to prioritize

Additional Information

Rippling is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to building a diverse and inclusive workforce and do not discriminate based on race, religion, color, national origin, ancestry, physical disability, mental disability, medical condition, genetic information, marital status, sex, gender, gender identity, gender expression, age, sexual orientation, veteran or military status, or any other legally protected characteristics, Rippling is committed to providing reasonable accommodations for candidates with disabilities who need assistance during the hiring process. To request a reasonable accommodation, please email accomodations@rippling.com.

This role will receive a competitive salary + benefits + equity. The salary for US-based employees will be aligned with one of the ranges below based on location; see which tier applies to your location here. A variety of factors are considered when determining someone’s compensation–including a candidate’s professional background, experience, and location. Final offer amounts may vary from the amounts listed below.

This position is a non-exempt, full-time, hourly position with eligibility for overtime

The pay range for this role is:

22 - 23 USD per hour(US Tier 2)

21 - 22 USD per hour(US Tier 3)

title: Senior Financial Accounting Analyst
descriptionHtml:
Dexian is assisting a client seeking a finance professional with an accounting background. We are excited to present the opportunity.


The role will sit as a hybrid model 3 days in office. We are looking for the following experience.


Responsibilities

  • Lead all aspects of budgeting, monthly forecasting, and long-range planning, with a focus on SG&A, headcount, workforce costs, sales, gross profit, and consolidated financials.
  • Oversee planning, forecasting, and monthly reporting of capital expenditures.
  • Collaborate with corporate departments to monitor expenses, analyze variances, and update forecasts.
  • Support quarterly business reviews and Board of Directors meetings by preparing presentations and conducting financial analyses, scenario modeling, and ad hoc reporting.
  • Partner with international affiliates to assess performance, conduct variance analysis, and manage intercompany transactions.
  • Maintain and enhance the Adaptive Planning financial forecasting model.
  • Provide analytical support for strategic initiatives and special projects; drive process improvements including automation and streamlining of reporting.
  • Perform additional tasks and responsibilities as assigned.

Requirements

  • Minimum of 3 years’ experience in a corporate FP&A role within a company with \$250M+ in revenue; candidates from consulting firms with FP&A experience will also be considered.
  • Proven expertise in financial consolidation and SG&A analysis.
  • Bachelor’s degree in Finance, Accounting, Statistics, or a related business discipline.
  • Advanced Excel modeling skills, including the ability to work with complex, multi-layered models.
  • Experience with Adaptive Planning is preferred but not required.
  • Strong analytical skills with the ability to interpret data, craft a compelling narrative, and influence business decisions.

title: Financial Analyst
descriptionHtml:
Senior Analyst – Digital Transformation

📍 Hybrid/Flexible | 💲 $85,600 – $120,925 + Bonus

Are you ready to shape the future of financial services while advancing your own career? At Empower, we’re driven by the belief that true financial freedom begins with empowering our people. We provide flexibility, career growth opportunities, and an inclusive culture where innovation thrives.

The Role

We are seeking a Senior Analyst to join our Digital Transformation team. This role is ideal for someone who thrives on solving complex challenges, leading strategic projects, and unlocking new efficiencies through technology. You’ll collaborate across Finance and Operations to streamline processes, implement automation, and drive initiatives that elevate both performance and customer outcomes.


Key Responsibilities

  • Lead modernization projects and introduce automation solutions using platforms such as Alteryx, RPA, and Tableau
  • Partner with IT and operational teams to enhance workflows, address system challenges, and recommend improvements
  • Design project roadmaps, monitor milestones, and provide updates to senior leaders
  • Mentor colleagues, build knowledge across the team, and promote continuous learning
  • Create documentation, refine procedures, and champion best practices that improve efficiency and scalability
  • Support business expansion through process improvements that enable seamless client onboarding


What You Bring

  • 5+ years’ experience in investment accounting or securities operations within financial services
  • Bachelor’s degree in Finance, Accounting, Information Systems, or related field (additional experience accepted in lieu of degree)
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with the ability to translate data into actionable insights
  • Advanced Microsoft Office expertise; familiarity with automation and reporting tools preferred
  • Excellent communication skills and high attention to detail


Why Work With Us

  • Competitive salary plus bonus potential
  • 401(k) with generous company match and financial planning resources
  • Medical, dental, vision, life insurance, and wellness benefits
  • Tuition reimbursement and professional development support
  • Paid parental leave, disability coverage, and volunteer hours
  • Generous PTO, holidays, and floating days off
  • Inclusive culture supported by Business Resource Groups and employee-led initiatives


Join a company where your ideas drive impact and your career growth is celebrated. Apply now and empower your future.

title: Third Party GRC Analyst
descriptionHtml:
We are partnered with one of our enterprise highly regulated clients who is looking for a Third Party GRC Analyst to join a high-performing Information Security team and drive meaningful impact across Third Party Risk Management (TPRM), Client Compliance, and IT Risk Management.

In this role you’ll be actively shaping and executing processes that keep the organization secure, compliant, and resilient. You'll collaborate across functions and play a key role in managing vendor risk, supporting client compliance requests, and enhancing GRC initiatives with continuous improvement and automation in mind.

What You’ll Do:

  • Partner closely with the TPRM Manager to guide vendors through the entire lifecycle — from onboarding to offboarding.
  • Lead and support third-party risk assessments to uncover and evaluate potential privacy and security risks.
  • Manage the collection and analysis of due diligence documentation (SOC reports, SIG questionnaires, security policies, etc.).
  • Evaluate vendor cybersecurity controls across hardware, software, and services in alignment with internal risk standards.
  • Collaborate with stakeholders and vendors to track remediation efforts and mitigate identified risks.
  • Contribute to client compliance efforts, including assessments, documentation, and client engagement.
  • Apply frameworks such as NIST CSF, ISO, GDPR, and CCPA to drive consistent, comprehensive evaluations.
  • Support contractual security review efforts in partnership with Procurement and Legal.
  • Continuously improve GRC practices, identifying automation opportunities and contributing to long-term program maturity.

What You Bring:

  • 3+ years of hands-on experience in Third Party Risk Management and GRC within a Big 4 firm or highly regulated enterprise (e.g., financial services, healthcare, legal).
  • Deep understanding of the TPRM lifecycle and GRC principles.
  • Strong knowledge of security and privacy frameworks (e.g., NIST, ISO) and regulatory requirements (e.g., GDPR, CCPA).
  • Highly organized, proactive, and able to work autonomously in a dynamic environment.
  • Clear and confident communication skills with the ability to engage both technical and non-technical audiences.

Why This Role Stands Out:

  • You’ll be embedded in a security-first culture that values risk intelligence, collaboration, and innovation.
  • You’ll work across departments and with clients, making your work visible and impactful.
  • You’ll have the chance to shape and improve GRC processes with a mindset toward automation and efficiency.
  • Remote-first flexibility, with preference for those based in Century City, Los Angeles, Orange County, Palo Alto, San Diego, or San Francisco to align with team operations.

Compensation: $100,000 – $125,000


No VISA sponsorship offered for this role. Candidates must be GC holders or US Citizens.

title: Vendor Operations Program Manager
descriptionHtml:
Teleion is Looking for a Vendor Operations Program Manager to Join Our Team!


Job Description:

We are seeking a highly motivated and experienced Program Manager to support a Vendor Operations team across multiple programs, including Contingent Worker Onboards and Vendor Optimization. This role is crucial in continuously improving the onboarding of new contingent workers and optimizing vendor-managed spending. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in vendor management, process improvement, and project management.

Goals:

  • Drive standardization in goal tracking and business review updates across Vendor Operations.
  • Scope and deliver cross-functional projects to improve Vendor Operations.
  • Develop and Enhance vendor onboarding processes to ensure smooth and efficient integration of new contingent workers.
  • Foster strong relationships with vendors and stakeholders to ensure long-term collaboration and achieving established goals.

Responsibilities:

  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify and resolve any issues that may impact vendor operations or onboarding.
  • Work with teams to maintain and develop accurate records of vendor operations and onboarding activities, ensuring data integrity and confidentiality.
  • Monitor industry trends and best practices to continuously improve processes.
  • Oversee the vendor onboarding process, ensuring all necessary documentation and requirements are met.
  • AI Change Management - Ability to drive and manage the transition to AI driven processes including delivering requirements, training and supporting team members.
  • Strong project management skills to oversee AI transformation projects from inception to completion.

Deliverables:

  • Analyze data for discrepancies, perform root cause analysis, propose continuous improvement projects, and deliver prioritized initiatives.
  • Foster relationships with stakeholders and other vendor partners to stay ahead of changing requirements, consider potential impacts, and educate contingent worker managers.
  • Drive process optimization and documentation including Standard Operating Procedures and guides, project status reports and content on wiki pages.
  • Develop reporting and resources to drive change management across corporate facilities for new and improved processes.
  • Discover, create, manage and implement new and improved process improvements across the onboarding, offboarding and vendor operations workstreams.
  • Create white papers and present recommendations to stakeholders for approval.
  • Build consensus and joint deliverables across diverse teams including shared KPI’s.
  • Work with stakeholders to contribute to AI engagement strategies across teams, manage a roadmap of automation projects, processes and workstreams.
  • Stakeholder engagement – Provide regular updates to stakeholders including program and project status, the progress and impact of AI transformation initiatives in corporate facilities.
  • Assess the potential impact of AI transformation across the Vendor Operations team. Leverage detailed analyses, feasibility studies, and recommendations for AI engagement.


Requirements:

  • Strong project management skills, including the ability to develop project plans, track progress, and manage resources.
  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to build strong relationships across teams with vendors and internal stakeholders.
  • Desire to learn and engage in AI solution discovery and development.
  • Data analysis skills to drive reporting and business insights.
  • Ability to work independently and as part of a team in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.
  • Strong attention to detail and the ability to manage ambiguity.
  • Ability to prioritize work, be adaptable, and proactively identify and solve problems with minimal supervision.
  • Work cross-functionally in a highly ambiguous environment, think critically and creatively.
  • Process mapping, documenting workflows, and writing Standard Operating Procedures.



Desired Skills:

  • Change management experience to anticipate impacts and communicate changes effectively.
  • Data analysis skills in systems like SmartSheet, Tableau, QuickSight, and/or Power BI.
  • Ability to take on various projects and support different teams.



This is a full-time role and Teleion offers full benefits, PTO, holiday, 401(k). See how other employees have reviewed us on Glassdoor.

Required: Eligibility to work in the United States without sponsorship presently or in the future.

For the 5th straight year Teleion has made the Seattle Business Magazine Washington’s 100 Best Place to Work list! (https://seattlebusinessmag.com/100-best-companies-work/100-best-companies-work-midsize)

Teleion is an Equal Opportunity Employer – We welcome all races, sexual orientations, gender identities, veterans, religions and disabilities

Ability to drive and manage the transition to AI driven processes including delivering requirements, training and supporting team members.Strong project management skills to oversee AI transformation projects from inception to completion.Deliverables:Analyze data for discrepancies, perform root cause analysis, propose continuous improvement projects, and deliver prioritized initiatives.Foster relationships with stakeholders and other vendor partners to stay ahead of changing requirements, consider potential impacts, and educate contingent worker managers.Drive process optimization and documentation including Standard Operating Procedures and guides, project status reports and content on wiki pages.Develop reporting and resources to drive change management across corporate facilities for new and improved processes.Discover, create, manage and implement new and improved process improvements across the onboarding, offboarding and vendor operations workstreams.Create white papers and present recommendations to stakeholders for approval.Build consensus and joint deliverables across diverse teams including shared KPI’s.Work with stakeholders to contribute to AI engagement strategies across teams, manage a roadmap of automation projects, processes and workstreams.Stakeholder engagement – Provide regular updates to stakeholders including program and project status, the progress and impact of AI transformation initiatives in corporate facilities.Assess the potential impact of AI transformation across the Vendor Operations team. Leverage detailed analyses, feasibility studies, and recommendations for AI engagement.Requirements:Strong project management skills, including the ability to develop project plans, track progress, and manage resources.Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to build strong relationships across teams with vendors and internal stakeholders.Desire to learn and engage in AI solution discovery and development.Data analysis skills to drive reporting and business insights.Ability to work independently and as part of a team in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.Strong attention to detail and the ability to manage ambiguity.Ability to prioritize work, be adaptable, and proactively identify and solve problems with minimal supervision.Work cross-functionally in a highly ambiguous environment, think critically and creatively.Process mapping, documenting workflows, and writing Standard Operating Procedures.Desired Skills:Change management experience to anticipate impacts and communicate changes effectively.Data analysis skills in systems like SmartSheet, Tableau, QuickSight, and/or Power BI.Ability to take on various projects and support different teams.This is a full-time role and Teleion offers full benefits, PTO, holiday, 401(k). See how other employees have reviewed us on Glassdoor.Required: Eligibility to work in the United States without sponsorship presently or in the future.For the 5th straight year Teleion has made the Seattle Business Magazine Washington’s 100 Best Place to Work list! (https://seattlebusinessmag.com/100-best-companies-work/100-best-companies-work-midsize)Teleion is an Equal Opportunity Employer – We welcome all races, sexual orientations, gender identities, veterans, religions and disabilities
jobPosterTitle: Recruiter at Teleion

title: Jr. Cloud Engineer
descriptionHtml:
Role Overview :

Sagitec Solutions is looking to fill a Junior Cloud Engineering position in our IT, Cloud, and Security Services (ITCS) division. This position will facilitate our cloud computing needs, including infrastructure design, automation, build, maintenance, support, and planning. We are looking for candidates with the ability to work independently and are highly functioning in team environments.

As a Junior Cloud Engineer, you will gain valuable experience as a key contributor, delivering enterprise level client systems. There will be heavy focus on deploying cloud infrastructure facilitating enterprise level client systems. Not only can you help us connect the dots and participate in the evolution of our cloud capabilities, but you’re also evolving your own capabilities as an engineer and keeping an eye on developments that can support service enhancements. All team resources are focused on high quality deliverables and ensuring value for our clients.


What You'll Be Doing :

  • Work in a supporting role to deploy cloud infrastructure facilitating enterprise level client systems.
  • Work with our security services team to implement remediations as a part of our vulnerability management program.
  • Participate in our patch management activities.
  • Perform on-call support activities on a regular rotation.
  • Implement automation and configuration management tools.
  • Assume multiple roles of IT professional, communicator, and business liaison.
  • Implement hybrid IT by integrating different cloud services with back-end, traditional data center services.
  • Migrate legacy applications to public cloud service in a rehosting approach.
  • Deploying services according to IT best practices for security, governance, identity access management, and monitoring.
  • Work in tandem with our dev teams to identify and implement the most optimal cloud-based solutions for the company.
  • Participate in planning, designing, and developing cloud-based applications.
  • Managing cloud environments in accordance with company security guidelines.
  • Deploy and debug cloud initiatives as needed in accordance with best practices throughout the development lifecycle.
  • Employ exceptional problem-solving skills, with the ability to see and solve issues before they snowball into problems.
  • Participate in division process improvement initiatives.
  • Stay current with industry trends, making recommendations as needed to help the company excel.
  • Stay current with industry trends, making recommendations as needed to help the company excel.
  • Support co-location data center operations, including on-site support.


What We're Looking For :

• Role Experience: 0-to-3-years’ experience.

• Industry Certifications: Azure and/or AWS.

• Familiarity with VM’s and server builds.

• Basic knowledge firewalls and Active Directory.

• Microsoft Office Suite.

• Strong organizational and communication skills.

• Collaboration and teamwork.

• Interpersonal skills.

• Excellent written, verbal, technical, and business communication.

• Willingness to travel up to 25% to clients and industry conferences.


Education:

High School, Bachelor's Degree


Compensation and Benefits:

Full-time / Permanent

$65,000 – $80,000 per year

401(k) plan with company match

Health insurance

Dental insurance

Vision insurance

Company Paid Group Life Insurance

Company Paid Short and Long-Term Disability

Voluntary Life Insurance

Flexible spending account

Paid time off

Company Holidays

Floating Holidays

Employee assistance program

Referral program

Tuition Assistance

title: Accounts Receivable Analyst
descriptionHtml:
What is the purpose of this role?

The Accounts Receivable & Collections Analyst will ensure DOOR maintains healthy cash flow and mitigates financial risk by managing customer credit, collecting outstanding payments, and supporting cross-functional teams with accurate, timely financial information. This role safeguards revenue integrity and strengthens customer relationships through proactive communication and resolution of account issues.


What is the role?

The Accounts Receivable & Collections Analyst oversees billing, payment processing, and credit management, while coordinating with sales, customer service, and accounting to resolve disputes, maintain compliance, and optimize receivables performance.


Who is DOOR?

DOOR (formerly Latch) is unlocking the next era of Building Intelligence. We combine premium hardware, intuitive software, and automated operations into one seamless platform—helping multifamily properties run more efficiently, grow revenue, and deliver smarter, more connected living experiences. From smart access and in-unit automation to building-wide controls, DOOR empowers owners, operators, and property teams to reduce overhead, protect asset value, and stand out in a competitive market.

We believe smarter buildings make life simpler. At DOOR, you’ll help shape a future where buildings anticipate needs, operate effortlessly, and quietly improve life for everyone inside.


What will you do?

  • Manage aging reports and proactively contact customers to collect past due balances.
  • Process daily invoices and accurately apply payments (Lock Box, Credit Cards, Wire Transfers, Sales Credits, etc.).
  • Make collection calls and maintain professionalism and diplomacy in customer service.
  • Process and track all credit applications and related documentation.
  • Manage and maintain tax documents for customer accounts.
  • Investigate and resolve customer and sales staff disputes and inquiries.
  • Maintain accurate and updated records of all customer interactions and account activity.
  • Contribute to audit support, reporting, and special projects.
  • Review customer contracts as needed for collections or dispute resolution.


What do you bring to DOOR?

  • 2–5 years of direct experience in collections or accounts receivable.
  • Skilled communicator—both written and verbal.
  • Strong conflict resolution, customer service, and problem-solving skills.
  • Proficient in Excel, Word, and accounting software (NetSuite is a plus).
  • Experience in cash application, credit holds, and sales tax documentation.
  • Knowledge of Supplier Waivers is a plus.
  • Ability to analyze data, define problems, and draw valid conclusions.
  • Excellent organizational and time management skills.


DOOR understands that job requirements sometimes exclude people who identify with historically marginalized groups from applying to jobs for which they are qualified. Even if you don’t meet 100% of the requirements listed, or if you achieved these requirements through unconventional channels, we encourage you to apply.


What is required (travel & physical requirements)?

  • Occasional Travel to DOOR locations/conferences.
  • This role will be in-person part time (2-3 days a week)


What does DOOR bring to the table?

We are reimagining what a supportive workplace looks like, from the inside out. To ensure every team member feels valued, we provide competitive compensation packages that reflect your skills and contributions. We offer a comprehensive suite of benefits such as employer-sponsored health, dental, vision and life options, and generous PTO, and an all-of-you, inclusive approach to benefits:

  • Parental Leave
  • DOOR provides company-supported parental leave for both primary and non-primary caregivers, along with tiered return-to-work options to support a smooth transition back to the workplace.
  • Flexible Time Off
  • We offer a flexible time off policy to ensure employees have the opportunity to rest, recharge, and maintain well-being—so they can bring their best selves to work.
  • Flexible Working Days
  • We support flexible work schedules, empowering employees to structure their workday in a way that best fits their personal and professional lives.
  • Comprehensive Health Coverage
  • We offer medical, dental, and vision plans with multiple coverage tiers, including the option to enroll domestic partners. Healthcare and flexible spending accounts (FSAs) are available, with employer contributions to help offset costs.
  • Life & AD&D Insurance
  • DOOR provides employer-paid basic life and accidental death & dismemberment (AD&D) insurance, with the option to purchase additional supplemental coverage.
  • Disability Benefits
  • We sponsor both short-term and long-term disability coverage, offering financial protection in the event of an illness or injury that prevents you from working.
  • Retirement Planning
  • Employees are eligible to enroll in a 401(k) Retirement Plan through Vanguard, with flexible contribution options to support long-term financial goals.
  • DOOR Equipment Setup!
  • Employees get a full setup of hardware from our home line of products as well as FREE monitoring!


Joining us means:

  • Having teammates all over the world in the US, Argentina, Spain and Romania.
  • Collaborating in a fast-paced environment where you can apply what you have learned in new challenges, and, more importantly, grow your career.
  • Being encouraged to invent and innovate within your role and working in a company where calculated risk-taking is highly encouraged and thinking outside the box is a must.

We embrace diversity and strive to create an inclusive environment for all.


Attention Job Seekers: Beware of job scams!

Job scams are on the rise, and you should take steps to protect yourself in your job search. Here are some guidelines to help you stay safe if you are applying for a job with Latch or DOOR:

  • Communications from Latch or DOOR will always come from @latch.com or @door.com. Do not accept a job interview invitation with Latch or DOOR from anyone who does not contact you through an email that comes from @latch.com or @door.com.
  • Latch never interviews candidates via Skype or in writing where you do not see the interviewer. All of our interviews happen either by video or in person.
  • We will never offer you a job based on a single conversation with someone claiming to be from our People organization. In all of our job interviews, you will always speak, by video or in person, with the hiring manager for the position.
  • Do not share your sensitive personal information with anyone who purports to offer you a job at Latch or DOOR unless you verified that the offer is from Latch or DOOR (check email senders addresses). We will never ask you for your bank account information or your mother’s maiden name during the interview process.
  • We will never ask you to purchase any equipment with a promise that we will reimburse you after you begin working for us.
  • If you believe you were a victim of a job scam, you may report it to the FBI: https://www.ic3.gov/.

title: Operations Associate
descriptionHtml:
Top asset management firm hiring for their middle office operations team in New York, New York.


REQUIREMENTS

  • Bachelor’s Degree in Finance or a relevant field
  • 2-3 years of experience in the financial services industry, relevant fund experience and/or administrator experience preferred
  • Proactive with a mindset for automation and process enhancement
  • High technical comfort level with systems and technology: working knowledge of FIS VPM, IVP products, PortfolioBI’s OMS, reconciliation systems, various Citco systems, CTM/ALERT a plus. Advanced Excel skills preferred
  • Comfortable communicating directly with a diverse group of internal and external contacts at all levels of the organization. Previous work directly with or at an administrator preferred.
  • Detail oriented and highly organized
  • Ability to adapt and work well independently as well as collaboratively


RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Assist in managing, reconciling, and processing activity (repo rolls, credit events, etc.) across various portfolios consisting of structured credit, repos, loans, and other fixed income products
  • Work with Administrators and Prime Brokers to help reconcile cash, positions, and P&L. Perform a full shadow of books and records to admin
  • Help develop best in class processes and procedures. This includes increasing efficiencies and automating where possible
  • Assist with daily trade management workflow including trade entry, portfolio pricing and entity allocations
  • Interact frequently with various internal teams, third party service providers, third party overseas Operations team, various banks and counterparties

title: Associate Product Analytics
descriptionHtml:
Position Title:  Associate, Product Analytics
Department:  Finance
Reports To:  Vice President of Analytics 
Supervisory Responsibilities: NA
FLSA Status: Exempt
 Job Type: Full-time
Location: US Remote


One Inc is looking for an Associate, Product Analytics to collaborate with our Product team to test, measure and build business solutions. The ideal candidate will be excited about using our comprehensive datasets to develop experiments, build forecasting models, automate dashboards and provide insights. In addition, the candidate should have a passion for converting business problems into hypotheses that can be answered through data analysis and A/B testing.   

 

Key Responsibilities: 

  • Create a suite of product metrics and dashboards to track usage and performance, identifying trends and opportunities for improvement. 

  • Collaborate with Product to create hypotheses, design A/B tests, and analyze results to guide decision-making. 

  • Support the development of business cases by quantifying the impact of proposed product features and enhancements. 

  • Build predictive models to inform product strategy, forecast user adoption, and measure models against actual performance. Proactively identify trends and make assumptions for changes in these trends.  

  • Define and implement processes for maintaining data quality and accuracy across product analytics tools and platforms. 

  • Present complex analytical findings in a clear, actionable format to stakeholders at all organizational levels. 

  • Continuously explore and recommend advanced analytical tools, methodologies, and best practices to elevate the organization's data capabilities. 

 

Qualifications: 

  • Bachelor's or Master’s degree in a quantitative field such as Data Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Economics or equivalent experience. 

  • 3+ years of experience in analytics and data science; proficiency in SQL and experience with data visualization tools (Power BI, Tableau, Looker). 

  • Experience in A/B testing and statistical modeling; proficiency in Python or R; familiarity with statistical packages. 

  • A passion for bringing objective evidence to every discussion; not satisfied to argue product features without referencing data and insights. 

  • Experience in Lean Product Management: applying the scientific method to software development (if we build x, we expect to achieve y, and we will know it by measuring z) 

  • Preferred candidates will have experience in: card issuing, merchant services, consumer-facing mobile applications, B2B payments, financial software, property & casualty insurance. 

Desired Traits: 

  • Action oriented, growth mindset, positive outlook, problem solver, self-starter, demonstrates ethical behavior, strong drive, team player, supportive & adaptable to change, exudes a commitment to personal & professional development. 

Physical Demands:

The conditions herein are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job.  Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential job functions.

 

Environment:

Standard indoor office setting; exposure to computer screens.

Physical:

Requires repetitive motion. Substantial movements/motions of the wrists hands, and/or fingers.  Sufficient mobility to work in an office setting; stand or sit for prolonged periods of time; operate office equipment including use of a computer keyboard, mouse, scanner and other tools as needed.

Vision:

See in the normal vision range with or without correction; vision sufficient to read computer screens and printed documents.

Hearing:

Ability to hear in the normal audio range with or without corrections.

 
Company Profile:  One Inc provides insurers with the capability to give their customers what they expect: choice, control, convenience, and continuity. That’s the strength derived from the Power of One™ - a cohesive and seamless experience for both inbound and outbound digital insurance payments.

The One Inc Digital Payments Platform combines multi-channel digital communications with electronic payment processing and disbursement, creating a frictionless premiums and claims payments experience. As one of the fastest growing digital payments platforms in the insurance industry, One Inc manages billions of dollars per year in premiums and claims payments.

Headquartered in Folsom, CA—One Inc offers a competitive salary, and benefits including medical, dental, and vision insurance, 401(k) plan, a commitment to a solid work/life balance, and a policy of promoting from within whenever possible.

One Inc is an equal opportunity employer and complies with all EEOC legislation in each jurisdiction it operates in.

 

Equal Opportunity Employer

This employer is required to notify all applicants of their rights pursuant to federal employment laws.
For further information, please review the Know Your Rights notice from the Department of Labor.

title: Scada Engineer
descriptionHtml:
🔧 We're Hiring: SCADA Engineer / Application Engineer

📍 Location: Onsite – Andover, MA (Boston area)

🕒 Duration: 12-month contract-to-hire (open to long-term contractors)

✈️ Travel Required: Occasional travel to Chicago, Upstate NY, and Atlanta for project integrations

Are you a hands-on engineer with a passion for building automation and industrial controls? We're looking for a SCADA/Application Engineer to join our team delivering high-quality design, commissioning, and support for critical Building Management Systems (BMS).


💼 About the Role

As part of our centralized software engineering team, you’ll be responsible for designing and testing control applications, commissioning BMS systems, and supporting our client sites during major integration phases. You’ll work closely with cross-functional teams to deliver fully operational solutions on time and within budget.


🎓 Required Qualifications

  • Bachelor’s degree in Mechanical, Electrical, or a related engineering field
  • 4+ years experience in Industrial Controls / Automation
  • Experience with Modicon PLCs and EcoStruxure Control Expert (Unity Pro)
  • Familiarity with Ignition SCADA and/or AVEVA System Platform


🔑 Key Responsibilities

  • Develop control programs using Function Block, scripting, and graphical tools
  • Design intuitive graphical interfaces for BMS operations
  • Perform on-site commissioning, startup, and system validation
  • Troubleshoot and test field devices and control logic
  • Follow software development standards and produce accurate documentation
  • Simulate and test project software prior to field deployment
  • Conduct user training and support post-installation issues
  • Manage servers or virtual machines to support control system deployments
  • QA/QC of all PLC and SCADA code prior to customer delivery


📍 Must be willing to work onsite daily in Andover, MA


👉 Apply now or message me directly for more information!

#SCADA #BMS #AutomationEngineer #ApplicationEngineer #PLC #IgnitionSCADA #AVEVA #Modicon #EcoStruxure #Hiring #EngineeringJobs #AndoverMA #ControlsEngineer

title: Private Equity Accountant – Not Your Typical Accounting Role
descriptionHtml:
🚨 Private Equity Accountant – Not Your Typical Accounting Role 🚨

📍 Hybrid | NYC | Private Equity / Special Situations Firm


Looking for something different? This isn’t your typical fund accounting job. Expect chaos. Expect challenges. Expect to learn a ton.


ConnectMe Capital’s client is a high-performing, close-knit Private Equity / Special Situations investment firm seeking an Accounting/Finance professional with a strong work ethic, private fund knowledge, and the drive to figure things out when there’s no playbook.


This role is perfect for someone who:


✅ Thrives in unstructured environments

✅ Loves solving messy problems and getting things across the finish line

✅ Knows the difference between a fund expense and a management company expense

✅ Wants exposure beyond accounting — ops, governance, automation, and more


🔍 What You’ll Do:


  • Own firm-level accounting and streamline core processes
  • Vet fund admin work — NAVs, reconciliations, allocations
  • Manage cash, prepare financials, and handle investor inquiries
  • Tackle fund issues as they arise — dig in, troubleshoot, resolve
  • Support everything but deals — including deal governance, compliance, and ad hoc projects


🧩 What You Bring:


  • 3–8 years’ experience in private funds (private equity, private credit, or real estate private equity)
  • 🔹 Hedge fund-only experience is not a fit
  • Solid understanding of fund structures (SPVs, feeders, etc.)
  • Experience closing the books / preparing financials
  • Strong Excel skills (pivot tables, VLOOKUP, SUMIF, etc.)
  • Effective communicator — confident working with CFOs and execs
  • Ability to figure things out when there’s no precedent
  • QuickBooks experience is a plus
  • CPA, public accounting, or forensic accounting experience is also a plus
  • Bachelor’s degree required
  • Willingness to travel and work hybrid in NYC


You’ll work in a small, entrepreneurial team with real growth opportunity. Once internal processes are humming, you’ll dive into the funds — solving problems, spotting issues others miss, and helping investors get their money back faster.

If you're a critical thinker who thrives in a fast-moving, roll-up-your-sleeves environment — we’d love to connect.


👉 Apply directly or message to learn more.

#privateequity #accountingjobs #nycjobs #financejobs #hiring #realassets

-   Ensure inter-operation of software modules into overall project in collaboration with project team

-   Establish and maintain effective working relationships and productive communication with parent company to facilitate cooperation and coordination in design and development planning and project execution

-   Maintain and evolve legacy systems as needed to support long-term functionality and modernization efforts

title: Data Engineer
descriptionHtml:
Airbus is committed to providing reasonable accommodations as an Equal Opportunity Employer to applicants with disabilities. If you require assistance or an accommodation to complete your application, please contact us at USCareers@airbus.com

  • Notice: Know Your Rights: Workplace Discrimination is Illegal
  • Notice: Pay Transparency Nondiscrimination (English)
  • Aviso: Transparencia en el Pago No Discriminacio´n (Spanish)

Job Description:

Acubed is looking for a Data Engineer who specializes in managing and optimizing data pipelines , with a specific focus on AI/ML data and applications . The ideal candidate will have experience in building data pipelines , implementing data infrastructure , ensuring high-quality labeled datasets, and collaborating with cross-functional teams to support our computer vision initiatives.

Why Join Us?:

Be a part of a dynamic team that values creativity, collaboration, and innovation. At Acubed, your contributions will directly impact our digital future. We welcome diverse perspectives and are committed to fostering an inclusive environment.

Meet The Team:

Founded in 2015, Acubed is the Silicon Valley innovation center of Airbus. As a global leader in aerospace, Airbus aims to make things fly . Our mission is to provide a lens into the future for the industry, transforming risk into opportunity to build the future of flight now. At Acubed, we strive to propel innovation to market faster, broaden the talent pool in emerging aerospace careers and simultaneously help drive a culture change across Airbus.

Our Wayfinder team is building scalable, certifiable autonomy systems to power the next generation of commercial aircraft. Our team of experts is driving the maturation of machine learning and other core technologies for autonomous flight; we are creating a reference architecture that includes hardware , software , and a data-driven development process to allow aircraft to perceive and react to their environment . Autonomous flight is transforming the transportation industry, and our team is at the heart of this revolution.

Your Working Environment :

Located in Silicon Valley, Acubed is the innovation center of Airbus - where our teams aim to provide a lens into the future for the industry, transforming risk into opportunity to build the future of flight right now. Our project portfolio takes on some of the industry’s biggest challenges and opportunities.

How We Care For You:

  • Great medical, dental, orthodontic and vision insurance and a 24/7 counseling service.
  • Free 24 Hour Fitness membership, which allows access to all locations in your region at no cost to you. Other options and onsite fitness classes available. Free onsite bikes for outdoor use.
  • Eat catered healthy, delicious food with your colleagues. Participate in happy hours, offsites and other social events.
  • If you choose flight training, we’ll fund your flight lessons ( up to $15,750) in either fixed-wing aircraft or helicopters.
  • Employees are eligible for 5 weeks vacation (25 days) their first year and 6 weeks (30 days) after two years of service. This PTO is in addition to 12 national holidays and unlimited sick days.

Your Challenges:

  • We are looking for a Data Engineer who specializes in managing and optimizing data pipelines , with a specific focus on AI/ML data and applications .
  • The ideal candidate will have experience in building data pipelines , implementing data infrastructure , ensuring high-quality labeled datasets, and collaborating with cross-functional teams to support our computer vision initiatives.
  • Oversee data lifecycle management, including data versioning, lineage tracking, quality assurance , and reporting
  • Design , build , and optimize robust and scalable data ingestion and labeling pipelines specifically for computer vision datasets
  • Manage and optimize data storage solutions to ensure efficient data retrieval and processing
  • Monitor and troubleshoot data pipeline issues, ensuring timely resolution and minimal disruption to project timelines.
  • Collaborate closely with AI/ML Engineers and Researchers to understand their data needs and provide efficient data solutions

Your Boarding Pass:

  • Bachelor's in Computer Science, Data Engineering, or a related field, with 2+ years of professional experience as a Data Engineer
  • Strong Python and SQL; Good software development fundamentals a must Demonstrated experience designing, building, and maintaining production-grade data pipelines
  • Proficiency with data modeling , ETL processes , data pipeline operations , and databases (e.g., Postgresql, Clickhouse).
  • Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail
  • Strong communication skills and the ability to work effectively in a collaborative team environment.

Nice To Have Experience:

  • Strong skills with data presentation tools, dashboards, and visualization such as Grafana, Plotly , Voxel51
  • Workflow orchestration tools, particularly Dagster
  • Experienced with databases like Postgresql, Clickhouse
  • Automation tools and CI/CD pipelines and containerization technologies (e.g. Docker)
  • Interest in aviation

Interested in pursuing this unique and challenging opportunity? Apply online here - Data Engineer - Acubed by Airbus

Please Note: Acubed does not offer sponsorship of employment-based nonimmigrant visa petitions for this role.

The estimated salary range for this position is $124,227 to $157,001 annually.

This job requires an awareness of any potential compliance risks and a commitment to act with integrity, as the foundation for the Company’s success, reputation and sustainable growth.

Company:

A^3 by Airbus LLC

Employment Type:

US - Direct Hire

Experience Level:

Professional

Remote Type:

Job Family:

Configuration Management

Job Posting End Date: 08.30.2025

Airbus provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, genetics, pregnancy, marital status, veteran status or other legally protected status. In addition to federal law requirements, Airbus complies with applicable state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment in every location in which the company has facilities. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, demotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation, benefits and training. Airbus expressly prohibits any form of workplace harassment based on race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, genetics, pregnancy, marital status, veteran status or other legally protected status. As a matter of policy, Airbus does not sponsor visas for US positions unless specified. Only applicants with current work authorization will be considered. Airbus does not offer tenured or guaranteed employment. Employment with Airbus is at will, meaning either the company or the employee can terminate the employment relationship at any time, with or without cause, with or without notice. Airbus reserves the right to revise or change job duties and responsibilities as the need arises. This position description does not constitute a written or implied contract of employment.

By submitting your CV or application you are consenting to Airbus using and storing information about you for monitoring purposes relating to your application or future employment. This information will only be used by Airbus.

Airbus is committed to achieving workforce diversity and creating an inclusive working environment. We welcome all applications irrespective of social and cultural background, age, gender, disability, sexual orientation or religious belief.

Airbus is, and always has been, committed to equal opportunities for all. As such, we will never ask for any type of monetary exchange in the frame of a recruitment process. Any impersonation of Airbus to do so should be reported to emsom@airbus.com .

title: Marketing Coordinator (Remote)
companyName: Empowered - Governance Risk and Compliance (GRC) Software
descriptionHtml:
ABOUT EMPOWERED

Empowered delivers world-class Governance, Risk, and Compliance (GRC) and ESG management solutions that help organizations streamline compliance, mitigate risk, and drive operational excellence. Our platform supports audit, risk, compliance, and ESG teams worldwide in achieving greater efficiency, insight, and strategic value.


We’re seeking a Marketing Coordinator to join our fast-paced, collaborative team. This role will be at the center of our marketing operations—ensuring campaigns, content, events, and partnerships run smoothly and deliver measurable results.


POSITION SUMMARY

The Marketing Coordinator will be responsible for supporting the execution of Empowered Systems’ marketing strategy. This includes managing campaign logistics, coordinating events, assisting with content creation, tracking performance metrics, and ensuring alignment between marketing, sales, and product teams.


This role is ideal for a highly organized, detail-oriented, and tech-savvy marketer who can manage multiple priorities and thrives in a high-growth SaaS environment.


KEY RESPONSIBILITIES

Campaign & Content Coordination

  • Assist in planning, executing, and optimizing integrated marketing campaigns across digital, email, and social channels.
  • Coordinate creation of marketing assets, including sales collateral, case studies, videos, and social content.
  • Maintain marketing calendar and ensure timely execution of deliverables.

Event & Webinar Management

  • Support planning and promotion of trade shows, webinars, and conferences (including Empowered Systems’ presence at industry events).
  • Coordinate booth logistics, event registrations, and lead capture processes.
  • Partner with Sales to ensure event follow-up and reporting are completed on time.

Digital Marketing Support

  • Update and manage website content in line with campaigns and product launches.
  • Assist with email marketing—list management, campaign setup, and reporting.
  • Help maintain social media presence and monitor engagement.

Analytics & Reporting

  • Track KPIs for campaigns, events, and content, compiling monthly performance reports.
  • Assist in lead tracking and reporting in CRM (HubSpot/Salesforce).
  • Ensure campaign data flows correctly between marketing automation and CRM systems.

Cross-Team Collaboration

  • Work closely with Sales to ensure marketing-qualified leads (MQLs) are handed off effectively.
  • Partner with Product to understand key features, releases, and messaging priorities.
  • Support partner marketing initiatives with Empowered’s strategic alliances.


QUALIFICATIONS

  • Bachelor’s degree in Marketing, Communications, Business, or related field.
  • 1–3 years of marketing experience (B2B SaaS or technology preferred).
  • Strong organizational and project management skills with attention to detail.
  • Proficiency with marketing automation tools (HubSpot, Marketo) and CRM systems (Salesforce, Dynamics).
  • Experience with social media management and basic content creation.
  • Comfortable working in a high-paced, results-driven environment.


SUCCESS METRICS

  • On-time delivery of marketing campaigns and assets.
  • Improved lead conversion from MQL to SQL through coordinated efforts.
  • Positive feedback from internal stakeholders on campaign execution.
  • Increased event attendance, engagement, and post-event conversion rates.


LOCATION REQUIREMENT

This is a fully remote role, but candidates must reside in one of the following states:

  • Colorado (Denver preferred)
  • Texas (Austin preferred)
  • New York
  • New Jersey
  • Massachusetts
  • Connecticut


COMPENSATION & BENEFITS

  • Base salary + uncapped commission
  • Competitive OTE with accelerators for overperformance
  • Comprehensive medical, dental, and vision insurance
  • 401(k) with company match
  • Generous PTO and paid holidays
  • Fully remote work with flexibility and autonomy
  • Career advancement opportunities in a rapidly growing company


WHY CHOOSE EMPOWERED?

You’ll sell a product that solves real problems in a space that’s evolving fast. You’ll join a tight-knit, performance-driven team where your work has visible impact. We’re building the most connected GRC platform on the market—and we’re just getting started.


If you’re ready to lead deals, drive revenue, and grow with a modern GRC company, we’d love to meet you.

title: Agentic AI Scientist
descriptionHtml:
Description

At Leidos, you'll contribute to AI solutions that serve critical national and global missions—ranging from defense and intelligence to healthcare, energy, and space exploration. Our work emphasizes Trusted Mission AI: systems that are transparent, ethical, resilient, and accountable. You’ll collaborate with multidisciplinary teams to transition AI research into operational environments where accuracy, security, and reliability are non-negotiable. Joining Leidos means applying your expertise to solve some of the most complex and meaningful challenges of our time.

We are looking for a motivated Agentic AI scientist who wants to work on challenging problems in a variety of domains – including enterprise IT, health, defense, intelligence, and energy – to get results that apply and go beyond the state of the art for measurably better outcomes. We apply our knowledge, capabilities, and experience to develop and deploy Trusted Mission AI – AI that deserves to be trusted by system owners, end users, and the public – to be accurate, ethical, reliable, and adaptable. We are looking for a applied researcher that is expert in envisioning, developing, and securing AI agents using generative AI and LLM-based tools to transform and add value to human workflows.

Primary Responsibilities.

The Senior Agentic AI Scientist will be creating AI agents to plan, act, assess, and deliver measurable outcomes. They will be working with a team to design, implement and deploy agentic workflows to both automate and optimize labor-intensive workflows, as well as empowering the human workforce to discover entirely new capabilities. As a member of the Leidos AI Accelerator, they will be tasked at different times with both R&D as well as customer-facing goals, to speed the transition of novel research into impact on contract.

The tasks of the Agentic AI Scientist will include fine-tuning and optimizing generative models, potentially applying domain adaptation with supervised and unsupervised approaches. They will develop with a combination of open source models, agentic tools, large proprietary commercial models, and small language models. They will be developing novel approaches to securing agentic workflows and to evaluating the results for accuracy, performance, and impact. They will be expected to ensure AI systems adhere to ethical guidelines, transparency, and fairness principles.

They should expect they may conduct research, develop prototypes, perform applied research, evaluate and document results, potentially through publication and presentation at conferences and other public forums. They should also expect they may be part of a team developing solutions for deployment into operational environments, or for integration into mission systems. They should be a self-starter while also working well within the team, collaborating and sharing discoveries and seeking feedback.

Multiple openings at various levels. The various position’s minimum education and experience requirements are as follows:

  • T1: Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering or related field and relevant experience
  • T2: Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering or related field and 2+ years of relevant experience, or a Masters degree with relevant experience

Basic/Required Qualifications.

  • Practical understanding of Large Language Models (LLMs) and agent frameworks such as LangChain, LangGraph, CrewAI, A2A, MCP, or AutoGen
  • Practical hands-on experience with generative AI models including prompt engineering, chain-of-thought reasoning, and Natural Language Processing (NLP) tasks such as entity extraction, summarization, and semantic search
  • Skilled in data exploration using Python-based tools (e.g., Pandas, NumPy, Jupyter)
  • Self-starter with a high degree of intellectual curiosity
  • Proficiency in Python and Machine Learning libraries such as Tensorflow
  • Ability to obtain a Secret clearance

Preferred Qualifications.

  • Ability to design and implement tool-using AI agents, including API integration, retrieval-augmented generation (RAG), and memory/context management
  • Hands-on experience with AI service integration such as NIMS, Azure OpenAI, Bedrock, GCP Vertex AI
  • Familiarity with deployment into virtualized and containerized environments (e.g., VMware, Docker, Kubernetes)
  • Hands-on GPU programming experience for ML workloads using CUDA, PyTorch, or TensorFlow, including optimization for performance and efficiency.
  • Expertise in designing and implementing safety, guardrails, and bias-mitigation strategies for autonomous agents and multi-agent systems
  • Experience developing Agentic AI solutions, including autonomous planning–execution–reflection loops, multi-agent collaboration, and coordination at scale
  • Familiarity with evaluation and observability tools for AI agents, such as LangSmith, OpenAI Evals, or custom telemetry systems
  • Experience integrating agents with cloud-native workflows, streaming data pipelines, and real-time decision-making environments

Come break things (in a good way). Then build them smarter.

We're the tech company everyone calls when things get weird. We don’t wear capes (they’re a safety hazard), but we do solve high-stakes problems with code, caffeine, and a healthy disregard for “how it’s always been done.”

Original Posting

August 14, 2025

For U.S. Positions: While subject to change based on business needs, Leidos reasonably anticipates that this job requisition will remain open for at least 3 days with an anticipated close date of no earlier than 3 days after the original posting date as listed above.

Pay Range

Pay Range $55,250.00 - $99,875.00

The Leidos pay range for this job level is a general guideline onlyand not a guarantee of compensation or salary. Additional factors considered in extending an offer include (but are not limited to) responsibilities of the job, education, experience, knowledge, skills, and abilities, as well as internal equity, alignment with market data, applicable bargaining agreement (if any), or other law.

title: Data & Systems Analyst - Environmental Programs
descriptionHtml:
Job Title: Data & Systems Analyst - Environmental Programs
Company: Mountaineer Risk Management (MRM)
Location: West Virginia, United States (Remote; occasional regional coordination)
Engagement: Part-time | Contract (1099)
Compensation: Hourly, based on experience (within allowable part-time hours)

About MRM
MRM began in Risk Management - specifically Health, Environmental, Safety & Security (HES&S) and Industrial Hygiene. Now, it also delivers end-to-end risk-to-resilience programs across environmental analytics, biosurveillance, data engineering, hazard modeling, and compliance. This role supports multi-site programs and is not tied to any single facility or party. We are methods-neutral and document findings transparently.

Role
Own auditable ETL and reporting for environmental programs (including pollinator-based biosurveillance); connect results to budgets; maintain chain-of-custody and data provenance.


What You’ll Do

Data ops: Design/Operate ETL (ingest, validate, normalize, store, etc.) for field, lab, and partner datasets

Analytics: QA checks, basic stats/trends, lightweight dashboards

Accounting Integration: Tie samples/batches to budgets/expenses for reconciled, traceable reporting (BvA)

Integrity & Governance: Versioning, metadata, role-based access; hashing/signing (where appropriate) for provenance

Secure Transfer: Automate SFTP/FTPS/AS2; package deliverables (CSV/Excel/PDF/EDD) with verification

Documentation: SOPs/methods and regulatory-format deliverables (submission packages and audit packs)


Must-Haves

- Python or C#/.NET (stack-flexible) + SQL and Git; file/API ETL you’ve shipped in production

- Data QA basics (types/units, missingness/outliers; MDL/LOQ concepts)

- Working knowledge of accounting flows (chart of accounts, reconciliations, budget vs. actuals)

- Clear technical writing (readmes/SOPs)

We value clean code, tests, and documentation over specific frameworks.


Preferences (Not Required)

- Lab/Agency data exposure; EQuIS EDD / SEDD v5 / WQX

- Dashboards (Tableau/Power BI/Looker); basic GIS/QGIS

- Secure transfer automation (SFTP/FTPS/AS2) and hashing/signing

- PFAS familiarity or other LC-MS/MS workflows (EPA Method 1633A helpful)


Success Metrics

Freshness/validation SLAs met; zero critical defects

Reproducible runs with full provenance (code, configs, metadata)

On-time reports with clean finance tie-out

EDD/CSV packages accepted without rework; end-to-end chain-of-custody documented


Engagement

1099 contractor; flexible part-time (target ~10-20 hrs/week; varies by phase)

Remote-first; occasional coordination in WV/adjacent states


Apply / Contact: DM me on LinkedIn with: (1) your core stack (Python or C#/.NET + SQL), (2) a brief ETL you’ve shipped (e.g. inputs, validations, outputs), and (3) any EQuIS/SEDD/WQX experience.

Keywords: Python, C#/.NET, SQL, ETL, QA/QC, Dashboards, LIMS, EQuIS EDD, SEDD v5, WQX, PFAS/1633A, Chain-of-Custody, SFTP/AS2, Audit Trails, Industrial Hygiene, Environmental Analytics, Remote
