title: Customer Success Manager
descriptionHtml:
Treeline, Inc., an award-winning sales recruiting and executive search agency, offering strategic sales staffing and recruitment services for leading companies in the United States and throughout North America. Dedicated to facilitating the placement of exceptional top sales talent professionals, Treeline stands at the forefront of advancing job careers of professionals in the sales industry!


Keep updated with the latest sales job opportunities nationwide by following Treeline on LinkedIn and activating our New Job Alerts!


Company Profile:


Our client is a growing tech company offering cloud-based financial reporting, business intelligence and workflow management solutions. With patented AI automation technology, they provide "ERP-like" functionality at a lower cost and complexity, empowering decision-makers with financial insights and actionable data. They are experiencing heavy growth with a small, close-knit team and are looking to expand their Customer Success division with a CX-focused CSM.


Job Description:


This is a unique opportunity to join a rapidly growing company at a pivotal stage as a Customer Success Manager with a focus on Customer Support / CX:


  • You will be the primary support and guidance for new and existing customers, owning ticketing queues and leading implementation as well as handling daily support calls.
  • Manage incoming support tickets in Zendesk/Salesforce Service Cloud, prioritizing and escalating issues to meet SLA targets.
  • Configure new customer accounts, lead virtual training sessions, and develop onboarding documentation.
  • Resolve software application questions, leveraging Excel/Google Sheets expertise for data manipulation and reporting tasks.


Requirements:


  • 3+ years of successful Customer Success, Customer Support or Technical Account Management work within a B2B software, SaaS or ARR organization.
  • Proven track record owning ticket queues and meeting SLA targets, with strong verbal and written communication skills.
  • Hands-on proficiency with Excel and Google Sheets (PivotTables, VLOOKUP, XLOOKUP) and experience with Salesforce Service Cloud.


Location: This is an hybrid work environment where you will have the flexibility to work from home on Monday, Thursday and Friday while reporting to an Austin, TX office Tuesday and Wednesday.


Job #5387


Base Salary: $65,000 - $80,000

Total Comp: $70,000 - $90,000

title: Founding Designer Advocate
descriptionHtml:
About SuperCraft

SuperCraft is a new way to design physical products using just natural language.\ \ Traditionally, designing physical products involved sketching, CAD modeling, rendering, reviewing, and iterating—a slow process that requires specialized skills. SuperCraft replaces much of that with one simple interface: language.\ \ With SuperCraft, anyone can conceptualize, prototype, and iterate on product ideas—fast. \ \ It’s already being used by over 17,000 people in industries like consumer goods, fashion, CPG, furniture and interior design.

Role Overview

You'll be a founding member of the team, working directly with Sarang (Founder & CEO) to drive adoption and awareness of SuperCraft across design teams in the industry.

Technical Content & Education

  • Create compelling technical content (blog posts, tutorials, video content) showcasing how to use SuperCraft
  • Own content marketing to increase designer discovery
  • Develop integration guides and workflow examples
  • Improve docs and onboarding based on community feedback

Community & Developer Experience

  • Build and nurture our user community through forums and social channels
  • Gather feedback from designers and translate it into actionable product roadmap input
  • Host meetups, workshops, and speak at conferences
  • Provide technical support to designers implementing our platform

\ Growth & Adoption:

  • Run experiments across growth channels and launch creative campaigns
  • Partner with companies, YC founders, and designer communities

This role offers the opportunity to define our industry relations function, mentor future team members, and grow alongside a rapidly expanding company in the generative AI space.

What We’re Looking For

  • Ownership
  • Strong communication skills
  • Good taste for design
  • Ability to automate
  • Prior startup experience
  • Bonus if you speak Mandarin or Korean

Benefits

  • Healthcare, dental, vision, all the good stuff
  • Base $90,000 - $160,000 (depends heavily on experience)
  • Every tool you need to succeed
  • Equity

Note: We do not sponsor Visas. This post is for US Citizens / GC holders only.

title: Human Resources Specialist & Data Efficiency
descriptionHtml:
POSITION PURPOSE AND SUMMARY


The HR Specialist -- Data & Efficiency will support the HSC HR Director in HR administration for the HSC. This role will also be highly organized and data-savvy to support our Human Resources team by streamlining processes, analyzing key HR metrics, and improving operational efficiency. This role combines traditional HR coordination with advanced data skills, helping drive strategic decision-making through automation and insight-driven reporting.



MAJOR / KEY JOB DUTIES

Human Resources

  • Assists in the administration of company engagement programs including troubleshooting issues, building relationships with vendors and increasing visibility and engagement of the programs.
  • Assists with HR administrative tasks such as processing changes (terminations).
  • Assists legal in pulling information for subpoenas, investigations, etc. including our NSR agreements.
  • Identifies, researches, and recommends process and system improvements to increase efficiency and enhance the employee experience within the HR area.
  • Assists with the planning and coordination of engagement events at the office.
  • Assists with other HR tasks as needed by HR Director.
  • Serves as back up to Office Clerk as needed (will be cross trained in various office services functions).
  • Assists with invoicing and reporting for office services.


Data and Reporting Specialist

  • Provides monthly and quarterly HR data and reporting support to HR functional teams for day-to-day needs as well as planned/scheduled activities and ad-hoc requests.
  • Creates and manages dashboards for HR metrics.
  • Builds automation workflows in Power Automate to enhance efficiency in current processes.
  • Uses data to identify trends and provide recommendations to leaders.
  • Develops, maintains, and enhances standard workforce reports.
  • Contributes to collection and reporting of data for compliance related reporting and external benchmarking.
  • Creates, manages, and optimizes workflows using Power Automate to reduce manual effort and enhance data flow
  • Builds dashboards, dynamic charts and tools, and interactive tables in Excel using advanced formulas, pivot tables and other tools.
  • Analyzes business requirements and capabilities for advanced data and reports to provide meaningful outcomes that align to drive business results.
  • Supports special projects from HR functional teams, such as Total Reward, Talent Acquisition, Learning & Development, Communications, etc.
  • Provides executive level presentations to support business decisions on data analytics.


OTHER DUTIES

  • May serve as backup to our office coordinator as needed
  • All other duties as assigned


KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, ABILITIES & COMPETENCIES



ORGANIZATION AND TIME MANAGEMENT SKILLS:

  • Ability to organize multiple projects; manage and prioritize multiple tasks and meet deadlines.
  • Ability to manage multiple vendors; ensuring positive vendor relationships

COMPUTER SKILLS

  • Basic knowledge of computers and software includes the ability to use e-mail, word processing, spreadsheet software, and property management system.
  • Advanced proficiency experience with Microsoft Suite products such as Word, Excel, PowerPoint, etc.
  • Proficient experience in Microsoft Forms, Power Automate
  • Tableau experience preferred

LANGUAGE SKILLS:

  • Ability to read and comprehend simple instructions, short correspondence, and memos. Ability to write simple correspondence. Ability to effectively present information in one‑on‑one and small group situations to customers, clients, and other employees of the organization. Conversational Spanish would be beneficial.


MATHEMATICAL SKILLS:

  • Ability to add, subtract, multiply, and divide in all units of measure, using whole numbers, common fractions, and decimals. Ability to compute rate, ratio, and percentage and to draw and interpret bar graphs.


REASONING ABILITY:

  • Ability to apply common sense understanding to carry out detailed but uninvolved written or oral instructions. Ability to deal with problems involving a few concrete variables in standardized situations.


PHYSICAL DEMANDS:

  • The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodation may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.


  • The position also requires that the employee regularly stands; walk; use hands to finger, handle, or feel objects, tools, or controls; talk or hear; and taste or smell. The employee frequently is required to reach with hands and arms. The employee is occasionally required to sit; climb or balance; and stoop, kneel, crouch, or crawl.


  • The position also requires the employee to be able to communicate via a computer.


  • The employee must occasionally lift and/or move up to 50 pounds. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, distance vision, color vision, peripheral vision, depth perception and the ability to adjust focus.

title: Spray Applications Technician ( Remote )
descriptionHtml:
Kindergan Landscaping has partnered with iHire to reach top talent for their opening below. Check it out and apply today!

  • Applying chemicals:

Spray technicians use various methods like sprays, dusts, vapors, or soil incorporation to apply chemicals.

  • Equipment operation:

They operate and maintain sprayers, spreaders, and other equipment needed for chemical application.

  • Safety and regulations:

They must follow safety procedures, manage chemical storage, and comply with local and federal regulations.

  • Inventory management:

They manage the inventory of chemicals, fertilizers, and pesticides.

  • Inspection and monitoring:

They inspect turf, plants, and other areas to identify pest or disease issues and determine the need for chemical treatment.

  • Record keeping:

They maintain accurate records of chemical applications and equipment maintenance.

  • Qualifications:
  • Licensure and certification: 3A and 3B.
  • Education: A high school diploma or equivalent may be preferred.
  • Experience: Previous experience in groundskeeping or landscaping can be beneficial.
  • Safety knowledge: Knowledge of OSHA standards and first-aid training can be an asset.

Employment Type: Full Time

Years Experience: 1 - 3 years

Bonus/Commission: No

title: Staff Accountant
descriptionHtml:
LHH is supporting a global private equity firm headquartered in Washington DC in their search for an Accountant to support the financial operations of the management company. This role offers exposure to a broad range of corporate accounting functions including general ledger maintenance, financial reporting, intercompany transactions, and process improvement initiatives.


Key Responsibilities

  • Prepare and post journal entries, ensuring accuracy and completeness across general ledger accounts
  • Assist with monthly and quarterly close processes, including account reconciliations and variance analysis
  • Support internal reporting and analysis for senior leadership and cross-functional teams
  • Maintain intercompany transaction records and assist with allocations and reimbursements between entities
  • Collaborate with fund accounting and operations teams to ensure alignment across financial systems
  • Participate in the preparation of audit schedules and respond to external auditor inquiries
  • Contribute to ongoing process improvement and automation efforts within the accounting function
  • Assist with special projects and ad-hoc financial analysis as needed
  • Maintain a strong understanding of the firm’s structure and entities to support accurate reporting and collaboration


Qualifications

  • Bachelor’s degree in Accounting, Finance, or a related field
  • Minimum 1-3+ years of relevant accounting experience; experience in private equity or financial services preferred
  • Solid understanding of general ledger accounting and financial reporting principles
  • Proficiency in Microsoft Excel and PowerPoint; experience with data analytics tools is a plus
  • Experience with ERP systems such as Microsoft Dynamics preferred
  • Strong organizational skills and attention to detail
  • Ability to work independently and collaboratively across departments
  • Professional demeanor and a proactive, problem-solving mindset


For immediate consideration, please email your resume to will.cumings@lhh.com


Equal Opportunity Employer/Veterans/Disabled


To read our Candidate Privacy Information Statement, which explains how we will use your information, please navigate to https://www.lhh.com/us/en/candidate-privacy


The Company will consider qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records in accordance with federal, state, and local laws and/or security clearance requirements, including, as applicable:

• The California Fair Chance Act

• Los Angeles City Fair Chance Ordinance

• Los Angeles County Fair Chance Ordinance for Employers

• San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance

title: Account Executive - Warehouse Automation
descriptionHtml:
We are seeking a motivated, high-energy, Account Executive to join our Automation Division. This role is responsible for the sale of our AS/RS and automated storage equipment line to our customers in the US. This is a complex sale, requiring a highly technically-minded and detail-focused sales professional with a passion for helping our customers find the best solution for their logistics and warehousing needs.


Responsibilities:

  • Maintain and increase sales with existing customers and expand market penetration through development of new business.
  • Prospect, identify, and contact potential clients to accurately assess client automation needs relative to the characteristics of their business.
  • Effectively communicate information about automation products and services to clients' appropriate decision makers.
  • Attend pre-bid meetings, validate specifications, and participate in the development of automation solutions that meet the customer's technical and commercial requirements
  • Consult with internal resources, such as Legal, Finance, Sales (racking), Technical office, Purchasing, Production, and Operations, to evaluate client requirements and develop a comprehensive project proposal to ensure customer satisfaction and completion of customer projects while ensuring time, milestone, revenue expectations are met.
  • Assist in the development of technical material, cost estimates, project and system handling concepts based on client needs, customer bid specifications, and Interlake Mecalux proposal documentation.
  • Deliver and present proposals and technical solutions to customers, participating in project review meetings with customers.
  • Manage customer contract negotiations, NDA's, and commercial items during bid process, including terms, delivery, payment schedule, insurance requirements, etc.
  • Understand the competition’s technology and pricing strategy. Provide feedback to Management and Parent Company to facilitate R&D efforts and new product development in support of the US market needs.
  • Maintain CRM database
  • Travel in furtherance of responsibilities.
  • Other duties as needed.


Minimum requirements:

  • Bachelor's degree in Engineering
  • At least two (2) years of previous warehouse automation sales experience
  • Personality: Candidates must have integrity, be highly analytical, and have a strong desire to be deeply involved in the business. Candidates must be organized and methodical in their work, with the ability to learn quickly and adapt easily to change. Candidates must be able to persevere through difficult work challenges with the highest degree of dedication. Candidates must have strong interpersonal skills with the confidence to interact and communicate effectively with personnel from all levels of the organization
  • Fluency in Spanish is valued.

title: Systems Support Analyst
descriptionHtml:
Systems Support Analyst

Hybrid, Sparks MD – 2-3 days in the office

Full time, permanent


Candidates must have either Commercial P&C Insurance or Financial Services Industry experience and a Bachelor's Degree.


Looking for a Junior/Mid-level candidate- System Administration/ Testing, Fix bugs, Request, Updates, SQL, SOP Development, Documentation of updates, workflow of requests, project support, help with implementation, coding language/how to read language- Salesforce and Origami would be great to have


The Systems Support Analyst supports the reliability and efficiency of IT systems critical to insurance operations. This role focuses on configuring and customizing business platforms to align with operational needs across departments such as underwriting, finance, and compliance, and ensuring the smooth day-to-day operation of internal platforms. The ideal candidate combines technical proficiency with an understanding of business processes, particularly in a regulated insurance environment.


Key Responsibilities

  • System Administration: Assist in the configuration, maintenance, and optimization of systems, including CRM (e.g., Salesforce) and claims platforms (e.g. Origami). To include development, testing, and implementation of requests/improvements.
  • User Support: Provide technical support to resolve system issues or user requests.
  • Data Management: Support data integrity by performing regular audits/reports, updates, and clean-ups in systems.
  • Process Improvement: Solicit feedback from teams, including surveys, documentation, and recommend process improvements to optimize the use of systems, by way of meetings or presentations.
  • Documentation: Assist in the management of user guides, training materials, SOPs, and system documentation/manuals.
  • Project Support: Work on system-related projects, such as implementing new tools or features, under the guidance of senior team members.
  • Security and Compliance: Follow security protocols and assist in ensuring systems comply with company policies and industry standards.


Qualifications

  • Bachelor’s degree in Information Technology, Computer Science, or a related field
  • 1–3 years of experience supporting business software applications, preferably in insurance, financial services, or other regulated industries
  • Familiarity with common insurance platforms, databases, or low-code systems is a plus (e.g., policy admin systems, Salesforce, DocuSign, or workflow tools)
  • Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite (Excel, Word, Teams) and familiarity with data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI) is a plus.
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
  • Solid understanding of SQL or other data query languages.
  • Experience with DevOps or similar tools used for automation, testing, deployment, and monitoring.
  • Ability to work collaboratively in a team-oriented environment.
  • Detail-oriented with the ability to manage multiple tasks simultaneously.



Preferred Skills

  • Experience with Origami Risk, HubSpot, or other CRM systems.
  • Understanding of HTML and/or XML language
  • Salesforce Certification: Salesforce Certified Administrator, Advanced Administrator, Business Analyst, or other.
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
  • Familiarity with scripting languages (e.g., Python, JavaScript) or system integration tools (e.g., Zapier, APIs).
  • Familiarity with business analysis tools and methodologies.
  • Basic knowledge of IT security and compliance best practices.


Vertex Solutions Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, creed, national origin, ancestry, religion, age, citizenship, sex, marital or veteran status, disability or handicap, sexual orientation or any other basis prohibited by applicable law.

title: Web Developer
descriptionHtml:
Why Charlie Health?

Millions of people across the country are navigating mental health conditions, substance use disorders, and eating disorders, but too often, they’re met with barriers to care. From limited local options and long wait times to treatment that lacks personalization, behavioral healthcare can leave people feeling unseen and unsupported.

Charlie Health exists to change that. Our mission is to connect the world to life-saving behavioral health treatment. We deliver personalized, virtual care rooted in connection—between clients and clinicians, care teams, loved ones, and the communities that support them. By focusing on people with complex needs, we’re expanding access to meaningful care and driving better outcomes from the comfort of home.

As a rapidly growing organization, we're reaching more communities every day and building a team that’s redefining what behavioral health treatment can look like. If you're ready to use your skills to drive lasting change and help more people access the care they deserve, we’d love to meet you.

About The Role

The Web Developer is responsible for supporting the stability, accuracy, and efficiency of Charlie Health’s WordPress platform and analytics infrastructure. This role assists with day-to-day site operations including structured content updates, A/B test execution, tracking integrity across GA4 and third-party tools, and performance maintenance. They will also contribute to scaling content frameworks, modernizing legacy code using LLM tools, and identifying opportunities to automate manual workflows. This role enables the web team to reduce technical debt, improve development velocity, and focus on strategic growth initiatives.

We’re a team of passionate, forward-thinking professionals eager to take on the challenge of the mental health crisis and play a formative role in providing life-saving solutions. If you’re inspired by our mission and energized by the opportunity to increase access to mental healthcare and impact millions of lives in a profound way, apply today.

Responsibilities

  • Review and understand the site’s codebase, theme structure, deployment process, and server architecture
  • Assist with content updates using WordPress (ACF-based), including bulk imports and templated workflows
  • Participate in A/B test setup and deployment via VWO; assist with test QA and post-test reporting
  • Consolidate and maintain internal documentation for tracking specs, workflows, and development standards
  • Manage tracking configurations and monitor health of tools like GA4, Osano, and VWO
  • Independently QA UTM and tracking data; implement lightweight automation for reporting and validation
  • Own execution of structured content updates and plugin maintenance with minimal oversight
  • Support rollout of programmatic SEO by assisting with templating, page creation, and QA
  • Use LLM tools to refactor and modernize portions of the existing codebase
  • Propose and implement base theme improvements for performance, maintainability, and scalability
  • Maintain and execute updates across Charlie Health subdomains (content and code)
  • Identify and propose automation opportunities to reduce manual maintenance and improve efficiency

Requirements

  • 1-3 years of experience working in WordPress theme development or related environments
  • Proficiency in HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and PHP
  • Familiarity with WordPress theme structure, ACF, multisite environments, and WP Engine or similar webhosts
  • Experience with analytics and tracking tools (GA4, Freshpaint, Osano, or equivalent)
  • Experience with A/B testing platforms (ideally VWO) including setup and monitoring
  • Ability to read and optimize legacy codebases, ideally with use of modern dev tools and LLMs
  • Strong QA and troubleshooting skills across both content and code workflows
  • Demonstrated ability to manage structured content updates and handle plugin maintenance safely
  • Attention to detail in formatting, testing, and documentation
  • Strong written communication skills for SOPs, change logs, and technical documentation
  • Self-starter capable of managing time effectively and identifying process improvement opportunities
  • Bonus: Experience with performance optimization (Lighthouse audits, lazy loading, caching) and automation tools

Benefits

Charlie Health is pleased to offer comprehensive benefits to all full-time, exempt employees. Read more about our benefits here.

The total target base compensation for this role will be between $79,000 and $100,000 per year at the commencement of employment. In addition to base compensation, this role also offers a performance bonus. The expected total cash compensation range, including potential bonus, will be between $83,000 and $105,000 per year. Please note, pay will be determined on an individualized basis and will be impacted by location, experience, expertise, internal pay equity, and other relevant business considerations. Further, cash compensation is only part of the total compensation package, which, depending on the position, may include stock options and other Charlie Health-sponsored benefits.

Our Values

  • Connection: Care deeply & inspire hope.
  • Congruence: Stay curious & heed the evidence.
  • Commitment: Act with urgency & don’t give up.

Please do not call our public clinical admissions line in regard to this or any other job posting.

Please be cautious of potential recruitment fraud. If you are interested in exploring opportunities at Charlie Health, please go directly to our Careers Page: https://www.charliehealth.com/careers/current-openings. Charlie Health will never ask you to pay a fee or download software as part of the interview process with our company. In addition, Charlie Health will not ask for your personal banking information until you have signed an offer of employment and completed onboarding paperwork that is provided by our People Operations team. All communications with Charlie Health Talent and People Operations professionals will only be sent from @charliehealth.com email addresses. Legitimate emails will never originate from gmail.com, yahoo.com, or other commercial email services.

Recruiting agencies, please do not submit unsolicited referrals for this or any open role. We have a roster of agencies with whom we partner, and we will not pay any fee associated with unsolicited referrals.

At Charlie Health, we value being an Equal Opportunity Employer. We strive to cultivate an environment where individuals can be their authentic selves. Being an Equal Opportunity Employer means every member of our team feels as though they are supported and belong. We value diverse perspectives to help us provide essential mental health and substance use disorder treatments to all young people.

Charlie Health applicants are assessed solely on their qualifications for the role, without regard to disability or need for accommodation.

By submitting your application, you agree to receive SMS messages from Charlie Health regarding your application. Message and data rates may apply. Message frequency varies. You can reply STOP to opt out at any time. For help, reply HELP.

title: Forensics Specialist
descriptionHtml:
The Company: Varonis (Nasdaq: VRNS) is a leader in data security, fighting a different battle than conventional cybersecurity companies. Our cloud-native Data Security Platform continuously discovers and classifies critical data, removes exposures, and detects advanced threats with AI-powered automation.

Thousands of organizations worldwide trust Varonis to defend their data wherever it lives — across SaaS, IaaS, and hybrid cloud environments. Customers use Varonis to automate a wide range of security outcomes, including data security posture management (DSPM), data classification, data access governance (DAG), data detection and response (DDR), data loss prevention (DLP), and insider risk management.

Varonis protects data first, not last. Learn more at www.varonis.com.

The Role: We are seeking a motivated Forensics Specialist to join our Varonis Forensics team. As a member of our elite cyber security experts, you will be at the forefront of cyber defense, taking charge of Incident Response engagements and providing crucial support for forensic investigations. Your contribution will be pivotal in delivering exceptional response and forensics services to our largest customers. You will work alongside our world-class blue team engineering and R&D teams, contributing to product development, fortifying customer security, and establishing your presence in the cyber tech ecosystem.

If you are passionate about cybersecurity and have a background in digital forensics, incident response, and SOC operations, this is the perfect opportunity for you to make an impact and advance your career. Join us on the front lines of cyber defense and help protect our customers from the ever-evolving threat landscape.

The Requirements:

  • 2+ years of experience working in Digital Forensics and Incident Response/SOC Teams
  • Demonstrate knowledge of Windows and Linux forensic techniques, tools, and concepts
  • Strong knowledge of network architecture fundamentals (Proxies, NAT, firewalls, IDPS, DMZ, etc.) as well as common network protocols and applications (TCP/UDP, DNS, HTTP/S, etc.)
  • Strong technical foundation of standard Information Technology concepts and services
  • Experience working with multiple enterprise security solutions (e.g., SIEMs, Firewalls, IDPS, AV/EDRs, IAM, DLP, etc.)
  • Demonstrate proven experience in Threat Intelligence (TI) with a focus on analyzing and understanding the tactics, techniques, and procedures of known Threat Actors and Advanced Persistent Threats (APTs).
  • Proven success contributing to a team-oriented environment
  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
  • Strong critical thinking, deductive reasoning, problem-solving, and prioritization skills
  • Experience working with common cloud technology providers (e.g., AWS, GCP, Azure) is an advantage
  • Be capable of adapting to a fluid and dynamic schedule, ensuring coverage during hours and days beyond the standard work week

The Responsibilities:

  • Become an essential member of our 24x7 follow-the-sun global team and collaborate closely with key stakeholders and customers.
  • Continuously enhancing security measures and instilling confidence by utilizing the Varonis platform, IOCs, and diverse forensic artifacts.
  • Independently lead and execute responses to high-profile cyber threat incidents in customer environments
  • Work with the customer to follow up on items that require additional investigation.
  • Conduct threat hunting using the Varonis platform and other SOC-related tools and platforms
  • Contribute to, and improve existing team processes while identifying new opportunities for customer impact
  • Contribute to the creation and enrichment of knowledge bases through detailed technical investigations and the discovery of new findings. Implement best practices based on these insights
  • Engage in close collaboration with our blue team engineering team to enhance the functionality of tools and update investigation playbooks
  • Serve internally and externally as a Cyber Security Subject Matter Expert (SME) to help educate peers and customers, when required

We invite you to check out our Instagram Page to gain further insight into the Varonis culture!

@VaronisLife

Varonis is an equal opportunity employer. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, veteran status, and other legally protected characteristics

title: Coordinator, Lifecycle Marketing
descriptionHtml:
About Lovevery

Lovevery is a fast-growing direct-to-consumer startup co-founded by successful serial entrepreneurs and based in Boise, Idaho. Our customers are parents, and our mission is to help them feel confident they are giving their children meaningful development experiences in the critical early years of life. Taking a science-based approach, Lovevery products have won awards from Fast Company, Modern Retail, Red Dot, Parents’ Choice, and NAPPA. TIME Magazine named The Play Kits subscription offering as one of the Best Inventions of 2018.

The Role

We are looking for a motivated and detail-oriented Coordinator, Lifecycle Marketing to join our marketing team. This entry-level role is an opportunity to learn the ins and outs of lifecycle marketing and support the execution and analysis of campaigns that drive acquisition, engagement, and retention across key channels: email, push notifications, and SMS. The ideal candidate has a desire to learn HTML and CSS to build beautiful and functional email campaigns while deepening experience in marketing tech, segmentation, and analytics. You’ll work cross-functionally with the growth team, design, copywriting, data, and product teams to help bring lifecycle strategies to life and deliver thoughtful, timely, and personalized customer experiences. This role is on the growth team and reports to the Sr. Manager of Lifecycle Marketing.

Responsibilities

  • Campaign Execution: Build, test, QA, and launch global lifecycle marketing campaigns (primarily in Klaviyo) across email, push, SMS, onsite and emerging channels, ensuring accuracy in design, copy and targeting.
  • Support Journeys: Help set up and optimize automated flows and customer journeys, ensuring they are aligned with the customer lifecycle and key business objectives.
  • Monitor Performance: Track campaign metrics and performance, providing initial analysis and insights to support continuous optimization. Report out on A/B tests to improve key metrics across the brand funnel. Validate that triggered and transactional campaigns are functioning as expected.
  • Project Management: Support with day-to-day management of the lifecycle marketing team queue to ensure tasks are assigned, prioritized and worked forward to deliver on time
  • Coupon and Offer Management: Support with coupon creation, code bank management, and other adjacent initiatives that are vital to the health of the business.
  • Product Catalog Maintenance: Maintain a catalog of products displayed in emails and that imagery reflects our current offerings.
  • Coordinate Assets: Collaborate with creative and copy teams to ensure timely delivery and accuracy of campaign assets.

Key Attributes for Success

  • Project Management: Organized and reliable, with a proven ability to manage workflows, meet deadlines, and drive efficiency in execution across teams.
  • Detail-Oriented: Exceptional organizational skills, an eye for detail, and strong cross-functional communication skills, ensuring accuracy in campaign execution.
  • Adaptability: Thrives in fast-paced environments and remains flexible to evolving priorities and timelines.
  • Desire to Learn & Optimize: Intellectual curiosity, with a focus on optimization and continuous improvement through a test-and-learn mentality.
  • Passion for Digital Marketing: An appreciation for a great online shopping experience and ability to bring ideas to life working within technical platforms to support integrated marketing campaigns.

Requirements

  • 1+ year of experience, preferably in marketing for direct-to-consumer (DTC) ecommerce businesses
  • A desire to learn lifecycle marketing, with specific focus on building email campaigns in HTML/CSS, drag and drop and other outlets. Willingness to learn CRM and Automation tools. Experience in Klaviyo or other similar platforms is a plus.
  • Basic knowledge/understanding of email best practices including accessibility requirements, client limitations (Outlook, Gmail, etc), and device limitations.
  • Analytical, data driven mindset. Proficiency in Microsoft Excel or Google Sheets, and experience with business intelligence tools such as Looker or Databricks is a plus.
  • Entrepreneurial mindset with a creative and resourceful approach to problem-solving
  • Bachelors Degree preferred
  • Availability to work collaboratively across global market time zones when needed
  • Remote eligible; Boise, Idaho, USA based candidates with ability to work on Mountain Standard Time zone preferred

The Benefits/Perks You'll Enjoy

  • Competitive salary, benefits and stock option package
  • 3 weeks PTO in year 1 +14 paid holidays
  • Generous parental leave
  • Any equipment you need to get the job done
  • Free/discounted Lovevery products

Based on market data and other factors, the salary range for this position is $50,000-$60,000. However, a salary higher or lower than this range may be appropriate for a candidate whose qualifications differ meaningfully from those listed in the job description.

Lovevery is proud to be an equal opportunity employer that values diversity in all forms. All employment decisions at Lovevery are based on business needs, job requirements, and individual qualifications, without regard to race, religion, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, HIV status, marital status, or any other status protected by the laws or regulations in the locations where we operate.

title: UPS Field Service Engineer
descriptionHtml:
UPS Field Service Engineer


$100,000 – $115,000 + 10% Guaranteed Bonus

*Technical and Career Progression

*Health/Vision/Dental

*401k


Our client is one of the premier global Critical Power manufacturers to source exceptional Field Engineers with a focus on UPS systems.


This is an exciting opportunity to gain factory training, career progression and a healthy work/life balance at one of the world's largest and well know companies.


The ideal candidate will have a strong background in UPS systems, including installation, servicing, start-ups, and commissioning. This role is crucial in supporting expansion efforts and enhancing service offerings to an ever-growing customer base.


Key Responsibilities

  • Responsible for commissioning, maintaining and providing emergency support on power electronics at customers’ sites within their respective regional coverage areas.
  • Render technical on-site and phone assistance to customers
  • Perform general and preventive maintenance on Uninterruptable Power Supply systems
  • Respond to emergency calls at customer’s request
  • Strive to provide all customers a ‘first time fix’ for their equipment
  • Provide accurate and timely communication to internal and external customers
  • Keep current on Safety Field Change Notices and Service Tips
  • Provide accurate and timely reporting of expense reports, Field Service Reports, etc.


Background Requirements

  • Experience as a UPS Field Service Engineer / Technician
  • Worked within a critical environment (Ideally data centers)
  • 3+ years’ experience in this field and ability to troubleshoot down to component level on equipment such as UPS, batteries, PDU’s / Power Distribution Units, Static Automatic Transfer Switches, Branch Circuit Monitoring, and other electrical equipment
  • Technical Degree in Electronics or Military Electronics Training a plus
  • Previous military experience and training a plus
  • Working knowledge of OHM’s law and electronic theory
